3MO0sUMX5UIMSh5qUwmLNw.text: Went there last week for drinks after dinner somewhere else.    The atmosphere is really nice, but the bar staff is unprofessional and seemed inexperienced.   We were sitting at the uncrowded bar at least 5 min, staff never came over.   The girls were busy talking amongst themselves and were more involved with doing busy work than waiting on customers.    After we called out to them to order a drink, they never checked back after a bit for another one.  They were too busy talking and putting on lip gloss!  Since they are newly open, will give another chance, but they need to have a seasoned bar staff if they want to keep customers.

SLGbJ4MQ5r12XFRanzmBng.text: The food and atmosphere are outstanding. The bartending needs to be quicker but the wait staff was knowledgeable and helpful as to what compliments each other for your meal.  The outside lounge and bar area was  fantastic with a variety of people from 21 to mature status which made it comfortable to move around, relax and people watch.  I highly recommend RumFish, but the prices are a little escalated, but it is the atmosphere that helps with the price challenge.

ArCCM_ZIKD-7Zsp0mLAjMw.text: Came here on a date night with my girlfriend  on a sunday, they were busy, but we were seated immediately. Atmosphere is excellent, beautiful outdoor seating area with a stage for a DJ or live music, the music playing was great too. We got our food very quickly, service was great. The mahi mahi is to die for. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys the atmosphere of a seaside bar and grill.

9BBm84VeT02TmyHqZrcpCQ.text: We had a very pleasant experience at their Sunday brunch.  The food was actually quite good, contrary to many recent posts.  This is a very nice place with unique and attractive decor.  The outside portion that just opened is a True marvel for Southsiders, and should be checked out by all.

zWpFA0WPzFFnJYiAqzjD9Q.text: Very good apps, everyone at our table loved their entrees,  and the desert was amazing.  Great drink specials and the waiter (Scotty) really took care of us.  The manager Mike came over and made sure we were happy with everything and gave great suggestions. Will come back again.

r1caZ2kJG63ZWsQPbifFXw.text: Fresh fish. Open kitchen. Beautiful decor. Amazing food and menu. By far one of my favorite places in the South Hills!!

l06X735Czr5e-kmYwkYftA.text: I had the fish stew and it was awesome- lots of fish, clams, mussels, shrimp and red potatoes in a saffron broth- delicious. However, who ever heard of happy hour specials on drinks and food depending on what area you are sitting- unbelievable. I went to the bar to get the special price. When my friends went, the waitress busted them. I paid half the price that my friends did. Happy hour prices should be fr the entire pace. IF I go back I for sure will sit at the bar.

skJkT60KrT8p0eDRG0lX6w.text: Nice outdoor patio, but that's about it. The food was flavorless except the sushi which was overly fishy, club music at 630PM is a bit odd.  Not going back.

T58K1geFWqvQd7mwFto-EA.text: So, they've retooled the menu since they first opened.  Our server told me that my mom and I are the only people who preferred the original menu... I'm not surprised.  Anyhow, there are no longer the different size pours for wine and the central menu item is now a "build your own dinner" idea.  It definitely works, provided you know how to pair fish or meat with sauce and sides.  I've done two different versions (both fish) and they've been pretty freaking fantastic.  The kitchen knows how to cook fish!  Also new since they opened is a HUGE outdoor space, complete with stage area and water features.  Haven't been outside to take advantage yet as it's been PACKED both times I've been since that opened.  Speaking of packed, with the outdoor space, the place is PACKED every evening... Parking can be kinda interesting in the small lot.  All in all, a great addition to the South Hills dining scene.

JLvxfrGmzoBJvkk7R5zw5g.text: Huge, landscaped outdoor "playground" for adults with sofas, waterfall pond, two bars, gas fire pits, and friendly service.  Great menu, though execution from the kitchen is inconsistent. Potatoes with the octopus were excellent the first time, but awful (too soft and vinegary, not at all fresh) the second time I ordered this plate.

5dECnkRazoqMFD-AmGaj0Q.text: We ate here tonight for the first time.  Bartender was very educated on the types of Oysters they had fresh. We had great drinks and several wonderful appetizers.  The sashimi was fresh and was made to order right in front of us.  The oysters were also shucked right in front of us.  We were just passing through and did not stay for dinner.  Everything coming out of the kitchen looked good.  The new outside area was open and looked like a lot of fun.  The owners brought your favorite beach restaurant to Pittsburgh.  I can't wait to get a babysitter and bring my wife out to this place for the evening.  The kind of place you can eat a good dinner and stay the night for drinks and entertainment. Great job with the design and menu.  I'm just jealous I don't live closer to Bridgeville. ;(

69wlepmQqQWjqFVW7ZBjXg.text: Went here for the first time with my wife for dinner, we where not that impressed,food wasn't bad, but wasn't good neither , for how much my salmon was, I didn't get that big of a piece, looks like a nice place to get drinks , but not to get dinner.

tEy5bpQXcNrNs37kPgXz9w.text: Stopped in for lunch Sunday. We were the only ones in the place at 1 pm. Food was not great- my fish sandwich was served on slightly stale, cold ciabatta bread with a side of underripe honeydew melon. For the price they could at least have decent bread for a fish sandwich!  Server was also creepy- would not leave us alone though we sent a clear vibe that we were ok as is. Asked us our names, where we were from etc etc. Came by the table no less than 8 times. I know he wasn't busy but For god sakes, leave us alone so we can eat and talk in peace. Won't be back- too many other decent places nearby- will just go to walnut grille instead!

1-eTBAm18cPilxbCQzzhOA.text: Once again I went back to a restaurant that I was not thrilled with to try again.  Why, I don't know but we did.  The first thing that you notice is that the raw bar is empty.  I don't know if that is a permanent status or just because we are finally getting rid of winter.  They asked if we wanted to sit outside and with the weather clearing of course we said yes.  What we didn't know was that our seats would still be wet so we all ended up with wet bums.  I ordered the shrimp boil as an appetizer, which being called a boil you would think it would be warm, but no it was cold.   Next I ordered the fish of the day and asked for it blackened.  Well, I guess that was a mistake because I received the driest piece of fish that I ever had before.  I told the waitress and she immediately took the meai of the check.  I really believe this place is more concerned with providing entertainment on their beach and being a bar than being a good restaurant.

AYHspjnPfnIopgjApCIFeQ.text: Just as I predicted....Rumfish brought it's A game to the Ville.   Since my initial review, I didn't go back for two weeks. They were making changes so I wanted to wait. When I did return, it was a night and day difference. Took the greasy Kennywood food off the menu and replaced it with healthier and high quality choices. AND started carrying the tequila I so love. My husband and I love Rumfish. Love everything about it. We seem to find ourselves there at least three times a week  The pork is to die for! Lamb shank is amazing. Whipped potatoes taste better than mom's. Ribeye for two is huge and intimidating but every bite is better than the last. Salmon is superb.  I could go on, but you need to check them out for yourself.    If you are someone who visited them early on and didn't like it, you need to go back. They've done a 360 and you've got to revisit them.  And now that the outside areas are mostly done, it's been the spot to see and be seen.

xNmfzNxSAkXIIH8fDk_OaA.text: Great atmosphere and something different then being in the city. That being said you get a lot of rich stuck up people from around the area who basically just march around acting as if they're the only ones there. Food is small portioned for the price and drinks are kind of pricey. DJ on Saturdays is very out of touch with current music and plays a lot of early 2000's songs.

PzJ-HS7TIZAoGdlG37-yEA.text: Food, service and management are terrible. Over priced to begin with AND we were overcharged which took 2 weeks to fix. $100 extra out of my bank account for 2 weeks. The saving grace here is their outdoor bar.. I'd skip the food for sure.. And bring cash.

p9AiTKUQvULkRq9_VXm-Mw.text: Food was very bland and unexciting.  You would enjoy the fish at long John silvers better.  Service was slow.  Price was high for lackluster food and service.  Not a repeat performance place

VOnsqoXpGOoyyhuA48OcBQ.text: I'm a bit of a hypocrite. I love good food. I love good fish. This restaurant has fabulous fish. I'm rating it 4 stars because there is so much to like about this restaurant. I'm a hypocrite because it is unlikely I will visit often. And as in all reviews it is a matter more of personal taste and less of objectivity on quality, because the quality is certainly there. The good: This restaurant knows it's fish. The restaurant itself is beautiful in a very urban chic style. More bars than I can count, an unusually large outdoor multiple bar area with couches, fire pits, open air pig roasting and a stage. This is an environment I would expect in Phoenix or Atlanta, yet it is here in Bridgeville. Indoors, modern decor, garage doors that open multiple walls to the outside, more bars, raw bar (oysters, sashimi), open kitchen, and clean bathrooms with nice soap. (yes, the quality of the soap does qualify for a review) The menu is multiple choice: you pick your fish, your sauce and your side. They have a kids menu with a house mac and cheese. M&C is also a side on the adult menu and is very very good.. (see my review on Sauce for my local obsession with mac and cheese) We ordered shark and the west coast fish of the day. THICK pieces of fish cooked a little rare in the center the way I like it. Very fresh tasting and proportioned appropriately Asparagus, mashed potatoes competent. The medium (which is mostly good): The atmosphere is social. They have about seven bars between the inside and the outside. The clientele starts older and moves younger as the hours get later. I'm old. so read me with a grain of salt, but when I lived in Atlanta and was much younger, I truly enjoyed a venue such as this and am glad we have one here. My impression: it's a great place to go after work, almost everyone appeared to be professional, it's a great place to meet age appropriate divorced people and a great place to take someone you met on match.com. This restaurant/bar really has a lot to offer in the social arena and If I were single I would absolutely take advantage of it. While I haven't experienced the later night, the stage indicates it's likely a lot of fun. The bad: The waitress knew nothing about fish other than the required pre-briefings. example conversation: what is the shark? answer: It's a meaty fish. Q: What is the west coast fish? A: It's a meaty fish. Q: have you tasted any of the menu? A: no. Q: what is the rum sauce? A: its a spicy mayonnaise based sauce best used on meaty fish. Q: what is the aioli? A: It's a mayonnaise based sauce best used on meaty fish. Yeah... not helpful. In fact most sauces here are modified tartar sauce...... in other words mayonnaise based. So if you, like me wanted a rum sauce with actual rum that was an actual sauce, you are out of luck. It wasn't horrible, it was mayonnaise with red pepper. The aioli was mayonnaise with spices. You get it. Best leave your kids at home because this is a fun place - especially if you are of the age to have kids but still like to go out, have some drink, good food but not want to go deaf or deal with the college set during dinner. For the young singles, later is a fabulous first date to impress and when the outside is open with a band....

DW7T6iVZ_96svMnkrErzAw.text: The South Hills may be overlooking a great place for fresh fish. The Tuna was fantastic. Barley risotto was a great compliment.

Nn8lhr5dl2wmGBfE7wCqPQ.text: Ok. Food, great bar ambience. Sea Ray Food was fresh, cooked right..would definitely try again

MNWrRNgrki5T-Pk9oBH14A.text: went out for appetizers and drinks with my husband. the food was alright but the service is what made it worth it. Ashley had us laughing the whole time. from start to finish she made us feel right at home!

ZetiibAQeANsqyfpJAb84w.text: Rumfish Grille is certainly worth visiting! Great outdoor area, especially the fire pit sections. Carla, our waitress, was excellent. She provided great advice on the menu selections and impeccable service.  Fish sandwich was one of the best we have had in Pittsburgh.  We will return!

TsTEuom_JbJqLsPcHJZF6w.text: I'm a sucker for an outside tiki bar. The patio is beautiful and very spacious. There are tables for dining in, an outdoor bar, and lounging areas.   I went there for dinner for a friend's birthday. We got a few appetizers and I got a chicken salad for dinner. Nothing too remarkable, but the prices are rather high for the quality of food. During this visit our server was rarely seen and it was too loud for her to accurately hear our order. We made the mistake of going on Thursday: biker night.   I did go back for the view though! It's not a world-changing spot for food, but it's an excellent environment for meeting up with a friend for a drink. They have plenty of tasty mixed drink options for your sweet tooth.

snsjmrcf-bxeOvhw3bF29w.text: We first sat at the bar for some drinks and apps. Becca was our bartender - very sweet and friendly. We ordered the calamari - a bit on the cold side -could have been from the cold sauce and cold lettuce bed. The buffalo chicken egg rolls were piping hot and quite good.  We decided to continue with dinner in the restaurant area. Ashley was a very attentive and knowledgable server. My salmon salad was delicious and my husbands mahi mahi good as well... but i will say that our server said the portions were big - but I found the serving average. We were able to watch the kitchen as we waited.. and didn't understand how a young man with a full head of dark hair was without any hat and how the servers themselves didn't have their hair tied back. I don't know if we'll be back as we spent close to $100 -even with a coupon.

o93rCRGWgzzQHC_p1zHytw.text: I went when they 1st opened and it was terrible! I ordered tuna steak and when it came it was gray! I sent it back & got a 2nd try and came the same way! I'm guessing it wasn't fresh tuna. I said I'd never go back again. The other day friends wanted to meet so we met there and gave them a second chance, thinking that well, they've been open for a while now. Maybe they straightened out their chef and kitchen. Nope. My husband got fish and said it so greasy, he couldn't eat it. I got the jambalaya with clams & mussels, and, it said, with red skin potatoes, but came with none. It basically was a bowl of mushy broth with bread on the side, with a bunch of EMPTY shells!! No meat in any of the shells. It tasted HORRIBLE!! Later that night, I woke up nauseous as heck and about an hour later, started with hours of diarrhea!! My husband said he was sick too. Horrendous! NEVER will eat there again!!

gMRYFPh86OPECDMdxomNYw.text: When I arrived here, I was quite impressed by the venue.  Ample outdoor space, a stage for live music.   What more could you ask for?   Well, anything beyond the venue would have been nice.  When I arrived at the outdoor stage, I looked at the menu and ordered a Dogfish Head 90 minute.  The bartender said that she has never heard of it.  She asked her coworker, and he had never heard of a 90 minute either.   I pointed to the beer listed on the menu, and they said "Oh, you can't get that out here.  It's only cans."   They seemed to be surprised that I didn't know that I couldn't order a bottle outside, despite them having given me a full menu outside.  Fine, so I ordered a Torpedo can.   They said that they're out of it.   OK.  Guinness is also on the cans menu, so I ordered that.  They said that they don't think that they have it.  She asked the other guy, and he said that he'd look.  They finally found one.  Now it's food time.  We tried to order the crab dip.   They said that the only thing that you can order outside is chips. You're not allowed to have any other food outside.  Again, they seemed to be surprised that we didn't just know this, despite being provided with a food menu outside.  Oddly, we saw some guy with a burger at some point.  Apparently they have a burger and hot dog place, And maybe if you grease the right palms, you can take your burger to the other part of the outside.  Or something.  We wanted real food, so we relocated to the inside bar.   We got crab dip, and it was perhaps the worst I've ever had.  You could do better with a plastic tub of anything from any grocery store.  It was some runny cheese, with some crab flavor.  Maybe a few shreds of crab scrap were in there, but it was hard to tell.    I ordered a dark and stormy.  It ended up being mostly sour mix.  I can only assume that they've never heard of a Dark and Stormy before, so they were just winging it.  We needed some more food, so we got some sushi.  I asked how many pieces came with a nigiri order, and our server had no clue.  Apparently it's two pieces.  When it came, the sushi was actually quite good.  But everything else about the place was bad enough that I can't give it more than one star.    The staff was distracted and oblivious about anything on the menu or what they had going on there.   The layout and operation of the place was clearly not something that had the customers in mind.  The whole operation was unprofessional and disrespectful.  The only reason I came here was for my friend whose band was  playing.  I might come back for him, but not for anything else.

pKVOaFTmnkBv9zA6RWBTBw.text: I read a lot of the reviews, some good and some not so good. But all that I read the good ones  were of the same experience we had. Our server, Madison did an excellent job. Our party of six received our food hot and well prepared. We intend to return in the near future.

qKuv03YcVudYqd0QtvS8Zg.text: Decided to go to lunch looked online at the lunch menu saw crab cake sandwich $12, some entrees for $14_or $15 dollars and thought Ok.  Walked in, should have been tipped off by the fact not one other table was occupied got the menu crab cake sandwich was $20 as was fish & chips other entrees were $23 or $24 dollars.  I ordered what was supposed to be blackened chicken on firecracker wrap don't know if the chix was blackened because I really couldn't find any was just lettuce and mango chopped up on a dry tortilla that was red.  My brother ordered $20 dollar fish&chips which was 2 medium size pieces of fish and some soggy fries. Don't waste your time or money. Have to give at least one star to post doesn't even deserve that.

29Blcr3SrA6sxeXV6yYH9A.text: Points for being a beautiful, beach-like outdoor space we were NOT expecting in a stripmall restaurant! We got the Rumfish punch-not my favorite cocktail-and the food was ok and inconsistent. My wife's salmon was so salty it was inedible, but the sushi was pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States

3qFLOD9JrSN0jMaXvVpWjg.text: It was my first time here tonight and it was packed on a Wednesday so it obviously isn't too bad. If you ask me, it was the food that brought people back-- not the service.  We got there about 25 minutes until 7. Happy hour ends at 7. We had reservations so we were seated as soon as we got here. Our waitress took her little time coming to take our orders. We wanted to get at least one round of drinks and appetizers at happy hour prices because the deals are great! She came to take our order 25 minutes later... Right when happy hour ended.   Drinks took about ten minutes but they were great. I'm a fan of Moscow mules and it was one of the best I've had. My dad and his girlfriend got mixed drinks and loved them too. My boyfriend got an IPA because he's picky about his old fashioneds.  The crab dip tasted like tuna to me. Not a big fan at all. I ordered the salmon, creamy polenta, and green beans. I actually really dislike any fish that isn't shellfish but the salmon only had a tiny hint of fishiness. You also got a dipping sauce for your fish. I got the chimichurri. My boyfriend had the tiger fish, polenta and asparagus with ponzu sauce. He loved his meal but we ended up switching sauces. All in all, the food was good- lacking in some areas but THE SERVICE IS ABSOLUTELY ABSOLUTELY 110% AWFUL.   Our waitress passed by us so many times when we needed more water, more drinks, or wanted to put in another appetizer order. I work in the service industry and I felt embarrassed for the management staff by how awful our waitress was to is and surrounding tables. They should consider taking on some more staff or teach their new staff how to cover all your tables in an efficient manner. All the tables around us had complaints about the service from what we could over hear.

FChvl8hc2C6lUetLcB2_wA.text: Zoey was a very nice waitress. Nice service and food was plentiful and tasty. I had the paella and I was stuffed after eating that. My daughters boyfriend and my son really liked the french fries.

I7H12xpLwi_iaBboUe5wqQ.text: This place has potential. Cool atmosphere. But my husband and I both ordered $30 entrees and it was frozen food that had been microwaved. For $30 a plate, I would expect fresh food.

NoBfvRgZCoRWffkuna1_WA.text: Great atmosphere and reasonable food but very lousy service. Took 20 minutest for the waitress to arrive, brought the drinks and the appetizers just before the food was delivered. It wasn't all that busy in the restaurant but very slow service. Rather just sit at one of the 3 bars instead next time

oef_oL1KjQjf9cymzULImw.text: We've been putting off coming here because my wife doesn't care much for seafood. I on the otherhand, love it. One weeknight we had just exercised at the nearby LA Fitness and wanted to try someplace different for dinner. It was a weeknight and we thought it wouldn't be too busy. We were not sorry for our decision.   The first thing I should mention was that we went on an unusually warm spring evening. Their patio was open and I have to say that you need to check this place out. We were surrounded by sand and waterfalls.  There were several firepits and couch style seating. They really make you feel as though you're on vacation.   I should mention that the service was very good. The food was also wonderful with enough selections from both the land and the sea to keep us both happy. The only downside was the the prices are a bit high, but the quality and atmosphere are worth it for special occasions,  like when the sun goes down.

XLf1rIbdBtircOL-oWBuxA.text: Was pretty hesitant to go after reading so many negative reviews. Glad i gave it a try. Ambience 10/10, food 10/10, service 9/10. Took away 1 point because of confusion among the servers. But when we got a server assigned. We had no complaints. Denia was our server and was very pleasant and gave us great recommendations. If you are thinking twice because of reading negative reviews, dont do so. Its worth a try!

l58WpzFNpvhVPq_j4jvrAg.text: Too good to be on a weekend night . Should try the fire cracker shrimp . Drinks are good . The outdoor appearance is flawless .

Em_CuPGjVAY4qx1Is9akZg.text: This place has 3 stars as of today and it isn't much better than that on its best day.  The food is average and the service is average.  The only thing this place has going for it is its outside where it feels like you are on a beach resort.  Other than that stick to easy drinks, make reservations someplace else to eat afterwards and make sure your bar tender and waitress gives you change after paying with cash. They will try to tip themselves.

w9824IaB-_dIg8uZdzKsDg.text: Food wasn't bad, the service was adequate...but the prices!?!?!  Dinner for two-one of us had water to drink, the other soda- was $80.  For what? You can pay half as much at any other seafood place and get  the same thing.  Unless you don't care about money or have a gift card. Stay away.

MmypZXKcVi9rWSzvAvt_7Q.text: Went here for a date night without the kids, because it looked really fun every time we've driven by. We were pretty disappointed with our experience. We were seated next to the kitchen even though it wasn't busy, then had a rather long wait for our server and the service was slow as well. The food was quite good when we got it, but the atmosphere really ruined it for us. Dissapointed.

2e7hQCCa9joIs4JbEFzdMA.text: Atmosphere like a Florida restaurant. Fun and tropical. Makes you feel like you are on vacation just by entering. The kitchen is wide open for viewing the preparation of food, which adds to the entertainment. Food is at least 4 star. Service was good. I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Flank steak with Brussel sprouts.... highly recommend!

TRHyoJBYAq2ia5bSzW0AsQ.text: My family and I went to rumfish , 45 minutes before the kitchen was closing . The server completely rushed us , to the point where it was uncomfortable to be there . The food was just ok.  This was my 4th time there and will be the last .

DMbjXreSqy7jBJ5AbHr9NQ.text: Great place to have lunch or dinner with friends. Food is delicious, service is great,and the outdoor patio can't be beat! Kimberly ,our server,was terrific! She handled quite a few tables on the patio and kept all of us happy with her diligence and speed. Loved it!

dD_61urwao6jcgKSFI_OrQ.text: Came here tonight for a date night. We were told it was a 45 minute wait but it ended up being 20 minutes. We were seated inside and had a great waitress. She was absolutely on top of it and had all our food out super quick even though she was very busy. The food was delicious, but unfortunately we asked to take the majority of our meal home as it was sweltering inside, the only reason I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars. We had the Crab dip, shrimp, jerk chicken pasta, and rumfish sandwich. All really good even when we brought it home!

pG7WCHYA7GPKx1_QyXQJaQ.text: I was just here less than a week ago, and I will definitely be coming back!   A friend and I were in the mood for some brunch (and of course cocktails) and we knew exactly where to go for good quality and friendly service. This place is definitely a hole in the wall; a very clean, friendly, inviting, and fun-filled atmospheric hole in the wall. You can definitely expect a different kind of atmosphere for each meal-time of the day.   I ordered a spicy bloody mary and the Po'boy shimp sandwich. Both were PERFECT! The bloody mary was spicy, but not overpowering and just the right amount of salty. The Po'boy was fresh, shrimp was cooked to perfection and soft. Definitely adding this to my favorite meals. Our waiter was friendly and on-point with his service.   Brunch is generally quiet, but fast service and you will definitely be taken care of right away. Lunch is average, but not too packed. Dinner is where the action is at. The open area outside is always lively with live music (in the summer), fire pits, waterfalls, and a very well stocked bar.   I would definitely recommend their Dark and Stormy mixed drink. It's ginger beer, lime, spiced rum. Out of this world delicious.   Great food! 10/10 Fast, friendly service 10/10 Atmosphere 10/10 Cocktails? OH heck yes 10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Their cocktails and mixed drinks are out-of-this-world amazing! My spicy bloody mary was perfect!

uS54TdyQglkvTIme8QzQPw.text: My husband and I visited the Rumfish Grill tonite for date nite. It was the second time within the last month we had been there.  Both times our waiter was Connor.  What a joy he was to wait on us! Personable, nice, efficient. I would definitely go back just to have him serve us!!

kfrhWthFqqtbpygDP8JbNA.text: We came on a Thursday night and we were surprised to find out it was Bike Night. We had a 45 minute wait.  I ordered the Lobster Bisque to start.  It came out looking looking unappealing and cold. The server took it to the back, nuked it, and brought it back.  It was hot but tasteless.  For dinner I had the shrimp tacos. The slaw on them totally made them. It was had citrus, vinegar, heat and crunch. I would definitely come back for those! My hubby had the Rumfish Stew. He cleaned his bowl!  I ate a scallop and a shrimp. The seafood and the soup were good.  I don't know that I would make the drive just to eat here, but would eat here if I was in the area.

XQbmOT4tl9f_0zXIMlqzrw.text: This was the worst food I've ate in a long time completely overpriced and if there was a way to give zero stars I would

dS9vQTSQSESuWAGc2L1Vzw.text: I've been here twice now and I'm not into it. When you first walk in to the outside part, the atmosphere is very cool. They do do a good job of emanating a "beach club" feel even though the place is in Bridgeville, Pennsylvania. But other than that everything else is just kind of mediocre to blah.   The last time I went I was meeting my sister-in-law and some of her friends for drinks and dinner. We had to wait for a table, so we got a few drinks from the outside bar and sat at one of the couches. It was already very busy so we were lucky. It took awhile to get seated. We were quoted a 20 minute wait, but it ended up being closer to 40 minutes.  After we were seated we waited awhile at the table before our waiter came over. He brought us water and asked one person we were with what she'd like to drink. She said she was just fine with water. He quickly looked around the table and said, "You're all good with water? Okay good. Be back in a little." He didn't really give anyone any time to actually order another drink. I was going to order the wine, but had to wait until he came back.   We sat again and looked at the menu for another 5-10 minutes. Our waiter came back and quickly took our orders. I ordered my wine and the Shrimp Po' Boy. The food did come out really fast. And it was decent. The Shrimp Po' Boy was pretty straightforward. The fries were actually really good. Everyone else liked their food. I think other people at the table got the Crab Cake Sandwich and the Chicken Sandwich. It was disappointing though that while we were eating the waiter didn't check in or anything. He just came back when our plates were clean with the check. It just surprised me that a restaurant that advertises itself as somewhat higher scale has service equivalent to what you'd find in a diner. I get that they're busy, but at least try to check in and see if our food is okay.  After we ate and paid we went back out to the outside bar area, which by this point was pretty packed. We had to stand since all the couches were occupied. We got a few more drinks and people-watched. The outside bar area is unfortunately pretty obnoxious. It was a club atmosphere but a relatively middle-aged crowd. It actually seemed like there were quite a few mid-life crisis middle-aged men hitting on women in their early 20s. It felt a little like Southside minus the college. Some people might be into that, but that atmosphere wasn't really for me.  It might have been really nice on a more chill night, but with it being that crowded and loud (a DJ was blaring club music) we decided not to stay too long.   In summary - food is decent, the atmosphere is cool and might have been cooler if it had been more relaxed that particular Friday I went, the club feeling it had though was lame and annoying, and the service is pretty shoddy. I'm not going to tell you not to go here. But it's definitely not anything amazing.

bQ69REcyudN_pvu0tdsfbg.text: Five out of our six dinners were not good,  we asked for bread, we were told there was a new chef and he didn't order accurately, they had run out. We asked if there were crackers/chips we were given chips we were charged for those chips.  We realize we should have said something immediately however, our waitress was extremely nice and we didn't want to cause any trouble for her. I called the following day and spoke with the restaurant manager who simply said sorry. We hope you dine with us again. I feel at the very least knowing five out of six dinners were bad she might have offered a free appetizer. We will not be returning regardless of their new chef, or transition. Poor customer service is poor customer service.

1TF85LMwQzmU4GJD2Piqbg.text: This was our first visit to Rumfish Grill and it will be our last. Despite being very uncrowded (on Mothers Day!) service was incredibly slow. We struggled to find our server for long periods of time and when located she was less than friendly.   When the food finally arrived an hour after arriving, it was lukewarm and tasteless. Requests for condiments were ignored. In the end we had to ask the hostess for our check since our waitress vanished.   The decor is nice, but unless you plan to just get drinks, I recommend going elsewhere.

OLFaWD7HsGdb9f5a9Lkkcw.text: This is one of the worst meals and service I've had. We were super excited for our dinner there, when we got there we were escorted to a private room for our party of 7. After that, it all went down hill. Our waitress was inattentive and we had to ask for refills on water and forks for dessert.  The salad came our with more rust then green on the leaves. The flat iron steaks were cold in the center, and bright red. They were almost 2 inches thick, so hard to get cooked perfectly. My son had the sea bass and it was gummy in the middle, definitely undercooked. The NY strip had no flavor (but the onion rings were good!). There was not one meal on our $230 bill that was decent. The one thing the place had going for it was its appetizers. They did give us $50 is gift certificate for food only, guess we will get appetizers.

NCVxMEHAWo2qxaQdOLEXcw.text: Had a great dinner tonight at rumfish.  Happy hour is now extended throughout the restaurant.  $5 apps and reduced drinks.. mussels and oysters! well worth it alone.  But we had dinner, crab cakes and a strip steak.. both really good.   They changed their menu a little and the only complaint is they don't have sauteed mushrooms for the 3 steak varieties they now offer. Live band playing soft music was a nice touch. Regardless, we will certainly be back.

d8oDWZHBi39PhkRF8Ogzqg.text: I had a wonderful experience at this location for dinner. I ordered the Salmon and it was cooked perfect with a side of roasted cauliflower. Also was seated in a private section of the restaurant with a curtain, this was a business dinner.  I really enjoyed everything and plan to take my wife here for dinner.

C7UNL_wh-d5S5NDvP16ZLw.text: First impressions are this is a pretty cool place. The outside area is cool and bar area is inviting. But the lack of service, especially on a Tuesday night that was mostly dead, everyone seemed disinterested. Took for ever to get served at the bar and the raw bar was nonexistent. I was set on seafood for the evening, so I stayed hoping that it would get better.   I ordered chicken egg roll apps and blackened mahi mahi. The buffalo chicken egg rolls were good but could have done without the cucumber sauce, (KISS--ranch or blue cheese.) I hate to say the service hasn't gotten better.  It has been over an hour and still no entree and I'm a party of ONE!!!  They keep saying my food is coming but at this point I'm not sure I want it.   FINALLY, it arrives. The fish is prepared well and Mac and cheese is really good. The Brussels Sprouts are fair at best. All and all a good meal but not worth the wait.   Food was 4 star but service was 2 star. Better luck next time.

PDLQ67fw8tTCWtNQDfXUKw.text: Went for lunch and the menu reflected usual fare (burgers, quesadillas, etc) and fish dishes; hence the name. Based on our waitresses recommendations, the wedge salad was just ok (the bacon was too hard, skimpy on the egg and blue cheese) and the chicken florentine sandwich wasn't that good. The Alfredo sauce seemed wrong. Our drinks were fine.   The atmosphere was very cool, nice outdoor seating - waterfalls and fire pits - very relaxing. We will come back and try again with some fish dishes next time and probably NOT take the wait staff recommendations- ours seemed a little spaced out.

aoFgfd9vSgLh1GwFp3mRRw.text: This was my first time at Rumfish Grille and it was overall a really good experience. We were able to get seated and waited on fairly quickly. The waiter was nice and served everyone very well and the food was okay. The architecture, atmosphere, and great outdoor space is definitely something you don't get around this area and serves as a great place to hang out with the family or friends. I ordered the Rumfish Wrap with grilled chicken and it also came with fries. It was good and the flavor was there, but it wasn't anything special nor did it have a wow factor. Quite frankly, I've had better wraps from Chipotle. I would rate this place as a 4-star because of the restaurant's great building and outdoor space, however because of the mediocre food I had brought it down to a 3-star. Don't let that turn you off, this place is definitely a try and I will come back sometime in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. My view of the outside sitting area from my table inside.

uA4TQr4p8RLJP9vFSW5Dog.text: The central business of this establishment is that of a trendy dance spot ... Not that of a place to have a seafood diner.  I went there for diner and ordered a negroni ... And was brought a peroni ... And my meal experience went down hill from there.

P_liMqsqzyBVp31vDJ60Bg.text: Being in the service industry myself, I rarely find time to complain about restaurants or bars. However, Rumfish Grille was so bad that it inspired me to sign up for Yelp and begin writing reviews.   The bartender must have forgotten to pour booze into our $9 cocktails to start the night. No problem - we can switch to IPA's. Except somehow both the bartender and waitress didn't notice that the beers were lukewarm. Maybe we would have had a chance to switch them had our waitress been around at all. She liked to hide.   Eh. It's okay. This $36 dish I ordered will surely make up for it. I should have taken a picture of this dish. For upwards of $36, they must have put about $3 into the plate. The chicken breast was maybe 3 oz.   The only redeeming quality of this place is the outside tiki area. Even then, if I want to spend $5 on an IC light I can gladly go to south side.   Avoid Rumfish unless you're a middle aged showboat who isn't practical enough to just save money and go to a real beach.

vI6ImQ1-tZzqbeZ6M2uzOQ.text: Driving through a strip mall parking lot you wouldn't expect much... maybe a hole in the wall type joint to visit after visiting big lots...  but we found this place....WOW! what a pleasant surprise!!  Came here with 9 people and the put us in a little room just for us in the back ( even without reservations!!) with our own TV :)  We asked and they gladly gave us the remote and we turned on the hockey game in the background :)  The weather was stinky and rainy, but there is a pretty amazing back patio with wicker chairs , water fountains and more.   ( Can't wait to come back here to sit out back) ....    The interior is nice as well.   Service was great...   The food was really good.   I selected a 'Create your own' option, in which you pick a protein ( Mahi Mahi, Crab cakes, Chicken breasts, Tuna, Salmon, Lobster tail, Shrimp and more... ) and then two sides ( Fries, mac n cheese, south African rice, whipped potatoes, veggies...etc)... and then a sauce ( chimichurri, asian ginger scallion, tartar, roasted garlic aioli, red pepper cream are just a few examples)... I went with Chicken/ African Rice/ Zucchini and Au poivre... I didn't even need the sauce... it was delicious without.   The friends who brought me here stated they come here often, and as I am on a project off and on that will bring to me the area, I will for sure be back and I can't wait to try something new .

B3oG6ds-J1mKELpanLe7HA.text: I don't know why the reviews for this place aren't better than what they are. The food was awesome! Happy hour was great! All of the appetizers except for like 1 were $5 for happy hour we tried coconut chicken.. Peel and eat shrimp.. Sushi.. And burger sliders.. The whole atmosphere was great!

xW1vE-FH3zNVh__Y4R-uow.text: This place is awful! Food portions are the size of a pea. I ordered seared salmon and it came out cooked completely. It looked like it was frozen and they just popped it out of a package. We also had the shrimp tacos. Gross!!! They were frozen shrimp that were hard and nasty. This place is expensive as hell. Our bill was $80 for one crappy mean and two appetizers! I will NEVER go back. I bet it's closed in the next year.   STAY AWAY!!!!

XJnYRZM1OuYl8JFZCS5z8w.text: Never had the food but the bar and outdoor area is a lot of fun at night. Drinks are a little pricey though. Its about as good as you'll get for a local bar.

dRIJK0xZV10LvzqIBxrP4Q.text: Very disappointed on our first (and last) visit. Music was too loud and made it difficult to have a conversation at our table. Trio appetizer was good, but so salty we kept drinking water all evening. I had the scallops and veal. The scallops were under cooked and the veal was 70% fat. I told the waiter and he brought another veal serving that was also 70% fat. Service was prompt until I complained about the veal. After that we had to ask 3 times for a water refill and had no one return to the table to inquire as to how our meal was. Ended up being an over priced and under appetizing meal.

l77uyEX5hCDZALJC914iHA.text: The first time I came here they had an amazing brunch spread. It was some buffet options plus an entree. Then they got rid of it. For a couple years they had a mixed grill on the menu, then they got rid of it. They had all you can eat crab legs every Thursday. Then without word, they got rid of it. Every time there's something worthwhile on this menu, they get rid of it and what's left is mediocre at best. Twice now my food has been cold after taking 30 minutes to come. Add all that to the $9 drinks and the fact that happy hour and drink specials are only available with bar seating makes this whole place not worth it. The waitress didn't know what beer was on tap. She didn't know what the dinner specials were. She couldn't tell us what fish pair with which sauce. Every time she had to go and ask and was gone for 10+ minutes. Never asked how the food was. Never coming back.

rV5rCDTpEygd7HR5tiHMtQ.text: The place is amazing.  We had a wonderful server and we got to sit in the private dining area since there were 10 of us their for a birthday get together.  I can't wait until the outside is open, it will truly be amazing once that gets open.    I do feel the menu needs some work.  More salad options would be nice for someone like me that doesn't really eat meat or seafood.  I did get the pork and it was wonderful.  I did an up charge for the risotto and was HIGHLY disappointed, it lacked a lot of flavor and was under cooked.  I would have been better off not paying the extra $2.00 and getting the whipped potatoes instead.  Prices are high for the area and I hope the food selection gets better and more refined or else the place is in trouble when it comes to the food.  People will for sure be there to drink when the outside is finished.  Lets just hope the place is still in business by the time that happens.

oQ35W2rgKCx8aReL5jbIjA.text: We had out of town guests and I wanted them to experience Rumfish.  We had other local choices, like Bonefish or Walnut Grille but our guests looked at the Rumfish menu on line and decided this is where they wanted to go.  We were seated in a dining room at about 6:40.  Shortly after that their "Game Night" started and from that point on, we were unable to hear the waitress, and she could not hear us.  We could not even speak to each other.  It was loud, like a concert-very loud!  We had to sit and eat and we're forced to listen to the loud game and emcee with his microphone.  Needless to say, it was a carnival ERatmosphere and I could not have a conversation with our guests.  I screamed at the waitress "WE CANT HEAR YOU".  She said, "ya I know, sorry".  The manager stopped by to ask about our meal and I had to scream "OUR FOOD IS GOOD BUT WE CANT HEAR EACH OTHER".  ER She said she would have them turn it down, but it wasn't enough to help.  The bill was $125, and we tipped our waitress $25.  We left disappointed and I apologized to our guests.  I have called the restaurant 3 times.  Once I got a recording and left a message for the manager Bree to call me.  Hasn't happened yet.  I called later and a bartender offered to help if possible, but I said I wanted to speak to the manager.  She was due in at 3 pm.  I called at 4 pm and was told she was too busy to come to the phone.  I left my name and number.  I haven't heard from her yet.  I'm not a prude and I like loud music, but this lousy game night, obviously done to draw business on a slow Tuesday night, was obnoxious and loud and ruined our dining experience.  The bar seemed to clear out as well.  We were seated in a dining room, but that didn't separate us from the noise.

gwbw9U7ZEX6TUGwSxi4CEw.text: I love this place! amazing appetizers and great happy hour specials. the way that the whole restaurant/bar/patio area is set up is great. they always have good entertainment and good atmosphere

IoDAOy0uJvXlnxIxnVoJog.text: We had an excellent meal. I am a creature of habit and always get the blackened salmon. It's the best I have ever had, every time! Can't wait to go back again! Recommend highly.

rjYPYRa4QcMORTiAPL4fsA.text: There were two good things about my visit. The cocktail and the server. The rest was awful. Seating was bad. They tried to put us next to the kitchen where the cooks has their drinks on the bar next to us took several attempts to get a new table. We were told the booths were for people with reservations. Which we had!! We finally got moved ordered and the appetizer came crab dip - it was stone cold. The only thing warm on the plate was the spoon  then came the dinners $32 for 5 quarter sized scallops and $25 for 2 burnt crab cakes. The potatoes were oily the veggies were soggy. It was just awful. The server did her best. She could tell it was not a good experience. Over all. Save your money and eat elsewhere!

S5jFf2f0GCntXG7lN85xVA.text: I'm rating this restaurant fair because I was disappointed I was charged a non-refundable $250 cost to reserve one outside firepit area for a party. I think this is expensive! The strange thing is there a party planner you are referred to to plan the whole party, but the restaurant was not on board or knew the things she was telling me. When I called the restaurant, the girls told me the outside area was free and first come, first serve. There was some open areas so wish I knew I could have come early and held a spot. We did order food outside, but the whole party could have ordered from the grill and had a space for $250 less. In my opinion, it would have been worth coming early to save that much money. Then I was told we had to spend $250 in addition for apps and drinks for our three hour window. The waitress did separate checks for us and never mentioned anything about this. They also told us we needed a list of guests attending for the door guys so our guests wouldn't be charged a cover fee at night. The night guys knew nothing of this? Again, no communication between the restaurant and the party planner. In the end, the outside area was beautiful, drinks were good and our waitress was great!! I just feel with all the money we spent at the restaurant in food and drinks and the business we brought, there shouldn't be a $250 cost for this. Again, if you want to charge this to people, I should have been told I could come early to hold an area and order food from the outside area.

wwy5g0we1QLAWXodV2pxjw.text: The food was mediocre at best. The sauces we tried were not good, they left something to be desired. And the fish was blackened, something we weren't aware. Getting a different sauce will cost a buck and take 10 minutes to arrive. The prices are very high and the portion very small. Without bread or a salad they ought to be more generous with the sides since fish isn't filling. For 50 bucks I want to leave stuffed. Good thing Sonic is down the street. We may come for lunch but def. not brunch since the prices are pricy and dinner left a lot to be desired.

87aHv14xwNshZomnAtf2Fg.text: The very first time we came here, it was an amazing experience.  Conch fritters were amazing and the sandwiches we got were delicious!  But the sandwiches are only during lunch and they took conch fritters off the menu and switched it with another fritter.  It is pricey, but the meals are customization.  Nice when you're trying to eat healthy!  Also they have an ad at LA Fitness that says that you can get a discount on lunch when you show your key tag! :)

llIvWQEu-Oz4vWFxZ4utCQ.text: I will never come back here again! My whole family came out to go to happy hour. It was busy, but our waitress was MIA. And she was not friendly or accommodating when she was there. Several times she came by to pick up empty glasses and never once asked if we needed drinks. I ended up going to the bar to get drinks, and the only redeeming quality about this place was the AWESOME bartender Ova, who made amazing drinks and was super fast. I hear he is no longer there - so there is no reason to waste your time going to this place. I have a gluten allergy and am a vegetarian also, and there was almost nothing on the menu for me to eat. Not that the waitress cared to ask the chef anyway. Like I said - don't waste your time.

lKAKc_Pd26QZPppm7IN4Cg.text: Looked like a neat place. Unfortunately, the service was bored, the food was bland and the only dish that didn't require cooking (sashimi) they forgot. We waited for almost 15 minutes  after our two dishes were delivered for the waiter to bring the sashimi. We understand that mistakes happen, but the total lack of urgency to correct it was what was so disappointing. They offered no discount for the late meal. My wife did like her shrimp tacos. I ordered the surf and turf sandwich and it lacked any flavor or seasoning. Our three meals with non alcoholic drinks came to $53. It wasn't worth it.  The outside is going to be nice when it's done. Went looking for a good lunch, left realizing it's a bar that serves food, badly.

GTActsvYJG0ZpypBGwDgTQ.text: We had seven of us in our group, everyone got something different and hated their food. I got the cod sandwich and it was terrible. I returned it because I could not eat it. The server came back and he said they ran out of cod and substituted catfish, I think it was bad fish. The surf and turf is a sandwich, it was fatty beef on a soggy roll. It should have been enough warning when only four tables were occupied at the peek of lunch time.

IU5LT9LjvzRE0vvh-a2Sfw.text: Came here with a friend for dinner on a Wednesday night.  Place was mostly empty.  The raw bar area was closed and empty. I think they are struggling, which given its location at the back corner of a strip mall, isn't a surprise.  The decor is attractively modern and upscale looking. The feeling that they aren't doing well continued as the service was slow but friendly.  I sensed they are understaffed right now.  It may improve once the weather improves. ?..they have a glass garage door that swings up to provide outdoor dining in warmer months.  That looks like that would be nice.  They didn't have any NA beer....until after we ordered.  The server came back 5  minutes later and announced they had something,  but I had decided to stick with water by that point.  My friend had mahi mahi  and I chose wooloo, (sp?) a Hawaiian fish I had never tried.   Both were outstanding. Very flavorful, cooked without dryness,  and a good portion.  We thought a nice touch was the care  taken with the sides (you choose your own).   The roasted cauliflower was really good, as were the rosemary red potatoes, and my friend enjoyed her roasted root veggies and quinoa. Most places treat sides as an afterthought.  Not here.   We passed on dessert, and there were only 3 choices anyway..... The pricing is high,  as others mentioned, I think because of its location in a strip mall that features Bottom Dollar and TJ Maxx.  I think this place would have no trouble getting $20+ an entree in Mt Lebanon or around South Park Mall.   Would I go back?   Probably would in the warmer months...if it's still there.

WS7xCEMHPCiblfUxOvabHg.text: A party of eight had dinner last evening.  Eric was our waiter and he was very pleasant and efficient.  Our food arrived hot and met our expectations.  The raw oysters and steamed mussels were delicious.  The restaurant was clean and nicely decorated.  I have no complaints.

9lo7FL-2nSryODXM59-Tyw.text: Great atmosphere. Upscale casual environment. Clearly a great spot for drinks and social gatherings with friends however the food is below average. Seems as if they have short order cooks preparing the food vs a True chef.

IUk0Mg-lYMlcDjr2nVFsxg.text: I have NEVER had a bad meal there! Larissa has always been my server and she rocks! The salmon is great but she's the real draw! Great service makes a place!

9cEHvTvy0Eg0392pAiyc4Q.text: manager is rude as hell. service was lacking. the bad service should not be ignored. I hear the food is ok but I won't be eating it.

1ghbJNtwiNXd6aX784jjnw.text: What a joke. This place was decent until I found out that they charged my debit card twice for the drinks that I had the previous week! I checked my account on line as I always do and seen that the cost of my bill plus the tip that I had left had been taken out of my account, although now there was another transaction for the original amount of my drinks taken from my bank account. I called the moment I seen it and asked to speak with a manager, which apparently there was not one there. I called the next day to speak with a manager who said he would call the account manager and figure out the issue of why it was happening and also call me back but that it "happens all the time." Like seriously?! Never called me back so of course I had to call him back and he was completely RUDE. He claimed to have left a message on my voicemail (I had my phone on me the entire time waiting for him to call back) which is obviously a lie. Not to mention he also said that he gets calls like this every week and never even apologized... What a shitty place with shitty managers that obviously don't know how to treat customers. If you get calls every week that your double charging people than maybe it's time to do something about it! I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy!

UjfqpQY8ELy2VvqAuu4ISQ.text: Excellent food and drinks.  Great outdoor area.  Although prices are a bit steep.  No salad with dinner and small glasses for drinks outdoors.  Otherwise it's a great place.  But not for those in a budget.

HclzLBU6SMgHqyCR8Nn8Kg.text: "awful new menu"   The food at rum fish used to be reasonably good. The atmosphere is amazing. However they changed the menu recently it's probably the worst food I've ever had. I've tried it three times since the new menu and every time has been extremely disappointing. They need to do something in a hurry or they're going to go out of business.

wlvsY7OhFKZ7zZ4mXPwQDA.text: We came here yesterday for New Year's Eve dinner, we got there at 6:20 with a group of ten people. The menu was super limited for the holiday, and the service was too. We all ordered apps/dinner/dessert. They had a special, if you got an appetizer and dessert it would be 10$ extra. We waited FOREVER for the appetizers, FOREVER for our dinners, not to mention the waitress forgot to bring me my alcoholic beverage for about 45 minutes, which she made sure to tell me was much more expensive. It's ok though, it's a holiday, and she must be flustered, but there was NO APOLOGY. So after waiting another 40 minutes for the waitress, she comes up to tell us that none of our desserts are available. We call the manager over, he is a complete passive jerk. How that man runs a restaurant with his attitude is beyond me. It's not about holding the 10$ charge, it's about your service. With no smile, no remorse, he said " what I'm doing for you is beyond fair" no one was even arguing with him. The waitress then took another 20 minutes to cut our checks. Needless to say we left the restaurant at 9:30. This place is totally not worth the money.

GWNIdvkALxb02cItOsmbuw.text: Sure it's cool if you want to drink but the food is awful bland watered down frozen seafood that is really underseasoned. Shame would be a cool place if the food wasn't so bad

fy5RL0zyvwMJ2c87gZ5RGg.text: The staff was friendly and the establishment looks great. The food was ok but didn't give me the flavors that i needed. The jambalaya is more of a stew than actual jambalaya and has chorizo in it which defies taste buds.

yHt_lSBRkmyukbzTCZrtlQ.text: Went with a group to rum fish tonite to listen to the band outdoors. Some in our group ordered burgers.  It took 45 minutes for the order to arrive.  The policy here is to serve inside people first, thus you wait and wait.  I ordered a dessert.  Apparently, you cannot order that outside but the waitress said she could do it.  So, wait and wait.  She comes over to our area many times for new drink orders. I ask how hard could it be to cut a brownie? Please make sure the ice cream hasn't melted. After 50 minutes I am handed a box.  Inside is a cake like dessert with marshmallow seared on top.  I immediately walk it over to waitress. She insists that is what I ordered.  When I say no, she continues to say I ordered it.  So I walk away and figure I'll try it. It is HORRIBLE!, I let my husband try it and he doesn't like it at all. So $10.00 wasted.  Overpriced, bad atttitude and not a good taste. This really left a bad taste in my mouth!, Can't reccomend rumfish for eating while listening to music.  They are not earning customer goodwill by their policies.

pMKEDPz2JOTezDbkbuQURA.text: My assessment would probably be 2.5. It was dark inside restaurant. Outside seating was available, however a band was playing and it was very loud and distracting to have a conversation. So we chose inside. Waiter didnt explain about happy hour appetizers. After we ordered them. Found out these could only be purchased at the bar. I ordered fried shrimp, Mexican street corn and brussel sprouts. The brussel sprouts was the best of what I had. Shrimp had a very soggy batter. Slide off the shrimp. Taste was off putting. 28.00 price tag. Mediocre meal for a pricey dinner

d8q7wQnvUSt34lnC3lLFMg.text: Overpriced food that is not very good.  Service was just ok.  Also, very strange seating policy that was very restrictive for a table for 6 guests.  If we weren't fairly hungry at the time, we would have left.  Bad feeling from the beginning that was reinforced by the food.

WKe7FqTkL-FBgrKCMFFIkA.text: Tough place to review if I am being honest, I have been there and had great food with great service and then have gone back only days later to have a completely different experience. The only thing that has been consistent is the poor quality of the lobster Mac n cheese. I had ordered it one time and before I could even take a bite I knew it had looked and smelled wrong immediately sent it back and then a co worker had ordered it the last time we where there he had said the same thing as I did but tried to eat it anyways after 3 bites he had told the server about how awful it was and she did not seem to care at all and basically dismissed us. May give this place another shot but still not sold.

1kid6QTjBE0k4LEhWsNpmg.text: Here is the deal. If it's a nice day, go there and sit outside. The place has a really nice back patio with a waterfall. That part is great. The food is just ok. When they first opened it was really good. Now it's just average. A lot of the menu items have changed since the beginning, and most not for the better.  There are some meals there that are very good. I had a salad last time that I really enjoyed. But I have also had some meals that were really bad.  It's really hit or miss. The staff is nice. They do their best.  The food is the only real problem.

a9ptTY79NR5yEJEoISl3Pg.text: I took my parents to Rumfish last night for their last night visiting from St. Louis. I had been so excited to try Rumfish for months, despite the fact that I heard very mediocre things about it. It looked like such a cool and unique place, and I had very high hopes for it. We arrived around 8pm. We were told there would be a 25 minute wait, which was odd considering the restaurant was fairly empty (including the outside section because it was pouring out). After waiting over 30 min, we started walking around to see what was going on. After doing this, we suddenly got a text that our table was ready, and as we were walking to the table we could see that almost every other table in the restaurant was empty. We ordered 4 waters and received them after about 5 minutes. We were already feeling a bit leery about staying, but decided to go ahead and order because we had already picked what we wanted to order since we had looked at a menu while waiting for the table. We even signed up for the mailing list and received a free appetizer and had an appetizer picked out to order as well. When the waitress brought our waters, she said (and I quote), "I will be back in exactly 2.5 seconds to take your order." After about 15 more minutes of sitting there and never seeing a single employee walking around, we decided we had no choice but to leave and take our business elsewhere. No one even saw us walk out of the restaurant or tried to get us to stay. We think they may have been understaffed because of the holiday. If they had informed us they were understaffed and running slower when we got there, we would have left right away with complete understanding and no negative feelings. All of us have worked in the restaurant industry and understand that can happen. The way Rumfish handled the situation was very frustrating and not aligned with good customer service practices.   We didn't get to the next restaurant until after 9pm. Thank you Rumfish for taking a (very frustrating) hour out of my last night with my parents. I will never go back.

V9pbyqXRunFHROYM87P--w.text: The bar tenders are really terible. My wife and her friends went there on Thursday night and there were hardly any folks but the bartender kept ignoring them for a long time. I also visited with a bunch of friends on a Saturday night and the bar tenders behaved indifferently and didn't serve us as they did others. We wanted to support our local business but had a terrible experience with Rumfish and Grille and never plan to go back. There are much better and fun bars at south side and strip district. Avoid!!

xFR8oZK93mXnuAgTsIijaQ.text: Amazing place to drink, coolest outside area in the south hills. Food is always a miss, check it out after dinner.

sjXs4i8NrU7Ysp8MAriFUA.text: Was very disappointed. Reservations were made for a high top table so we could hear the band, but when we got there, it wasn't available. We  were informed that our table that we requested was being used as a part of a private party. The manager , offered to buy us a round of drinks. The food was way over priced for the quality. My wife and I each ordered Strawberry and Kiwi salad priced at $13. if you want to add chicken for $4, or Steak for $7, that was a option. Without paying the extra for the meat, the salad would have consisted of what appeard to be discarded lawn shaving with a total of 4 pieces of strawberries and a couple of pieces of kiwi. All for $13. for the basic salad. Wendy's definitely offer a far superior Salad for less than 1/2 the price.  Never again!!!!

zDahRe5kW4Dz-A42WgYtVg.text: The food was fine. The service was absolutely terrible. We had a party of 12 and made a reservation. After we had already ordered drinks we were told that they can't split a bill on the weekend for parties over 8. None of this was communicated to us when the initial reservation was made. We asked to speak to the manager to see if they would split the check and he immediately showed up angrily and said "what?!"rolling his neck and he spoke down to us and telling us what he wasn't gonna do for us because he had other customers to attend to. I'll never step back in here and I'll tell everyone I know never to spend a dime in here. I work to hard for my money to spend it in a place where your management thinks it's okay to speak to people any kind of way.

GeInyL6v6NZ_QR4cp-V_iw.text: The food was great! We had a large family with us and were on a time limit - all ordered something different and enjoyed everything! Ashley was our waitress and she was the best! We will be back again!

QvwIBSmSt4Qk7W0YSixQ4A.text: I concur with all of the poor reviews 100%.  The owner needs to decide if this is going to be a nightclub or a restaurant.  The "slow" service is always lackluster to poor, the portions are tiny (I recently ordered a shrimp po' boy hoagie and got all of 5 small, overcooked shrimp and a whole lot of white bread) and the prices are borderline ridiculous.  (They charge $5-10 less than Morton's for the surf & turf for essentially a half-size portion.)  And don't bother to ask the servers about anything seafood related - as they seem to know nothing about the food. How fresh are the fish options, how often are they delivered, are they delivered fresh or frozen, do you microwave?  They never have any answers.  The vibe is very strange.  While the beach & live music is nice, it's seasonal and there is absolutely nothing special about this place for the other 7-8 months of the year.  And the place is not family friendly - especially with the "suburban" bikers and related attitude.  That's why on a recent Thursday night the Mexican place next door was packed with families and this place was almost deserted. I really tried to give them a chance (Pittsburgh desperately needs non-chain seafood dining options since this is the epitome of a "meat & potatoes" town), but Rumfish is just plain bad.

y1JViI2JzvXTjGlp13Qmfw.text: Had dinner at Rumfish tonight and I was THRILLED to see that Create Your Own was back on the menu!! And the new pulled pork nachos are incredible! Everyone had a great time and we can't wait to come back again!

FDj4sYqidLZKT9e-3ZVnGg.text: I have wanted to try Rumfish for an actual meal for the past year and sadly the experience was not worth the wait. Being that it was a seafood type place I wanted to go with my go to, fish tacos. I was extremely disappointed with the dish. They had little to no flavor. If they would just create a better, more flavorful slaw to top it with it could be 10x better. It pretty much tasted like they just threw some cabbage in a tortilla with some fish and threw 1 sliced jalapeno on each. On top of that we finished eating and waited probably 15 min before we saw our waiter to get our checks.

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States

1ZTCRW9K8lBKRPPOyh0pmg.text: Went to Rumfish last night and they are in the process of switching their menu.  Unfortunately half of the appetizers listed on the menu they didn't offer any longer. So we started with the oysters and crab dip.  Crab dip was good, oysters not so much.  Why would you put brie cheese on an oyster?  You can imagine the taste and texture.  Next we ordered scallops and porch in mushroom risotto.  Scallops were very tasty and the risotto was like mushroom porridge,Yuk! So the server did try to offer alternatives and we went with red potatoes however they were in olive oil and garlic but no salt and pepper.  Could have been much more flavorful.  Then when we went to the outdoor area, I ordered a blue moon and a Yuengling light as they couldn't offer the Sam Adams beer that we had on the patio.  Ok then.  But then the server comes back to say they are out of Yuengling Light.  Really?  Are we in Pittsburgh?  Let's talk ambiance.  When we arrived there was a local band playing which did a good job and the bar outside was busy. They stopped at 9 though to switch to a dj format.  Unfortunately at 10:45 the dj was STILL messing with his playlist and high school lighting.  I me toned it to the bathroom attendant who was just as frustrated but when I asked the bouncer why someone hasn't told the dj to get going he just shrugged his shoulder.  Needless to say we left.  I realize there aren't too many options for an outdoor club at night but really, management you really need to get your act together.  Lots of new places opening around town and you either can: excel, keep up or close.

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Nice fire pits to warm your toes.

LPscT4MhmUTGNOEBTzyZDg.text: Very small  lunch menu, however if you ask they will provide!!  Waitress was pushy trying to get us in & out, other than that very nice place. If you want to go on a date and have a few drinks or even go out with some coworkers  Cleanliness - 6/10 Quality of Food - 7.8/10 Service - 7/10

3A8atK1qZqcFJARHtCYnyg.text: Food and drinks are not bad.  Actually, when I've been there specifically for dinner, I've been quite pleased.  My issue with Rumfish is their nightlife.  The atmosphere is great, drinks are cheap and good, usually the entertainment they have is good -- all around, I wish I could enjoy it because I have in the past on several occasions.  Unfortunately, it was ruined for me a couple summers ago.  We got there at 8, I was asked for my ID by a bouncer and I gave it to him.  I was like 26 at the time, or somewhere around there.  No big deal.  Then, four hours, four cocktails, and a shot or two later, I was accosted coming out of the bathroom by an employee for my ID.  Well, sorry, dude.  But since I was carded when I came in, I didn't take it with me to go urinate.  So this douche follows me all the way back to my little fire pit area just so he can look at my ID.  And he was rude about it.  I expressed my disdain at the time, and on their Facebook page a few days later.  You know, it's not like I'm offended by being carded upon entry.  But get a better system.  If they don't trust their bouncers, get new ones.  If they still don't trust them, get a wristband or something obvious like they do in every other nightlife location so they don't have to police people at the bathroom.  Like, just because I don't feel like wearing a fuck-me dress every time I go out, it shouldn't mean that I should just expect to be policed multiple times after already having been somewhere for hours.  Sorry I take care of my skin, and have tiny boobs, and that just makes you assume I'm 11.  Ugh.

Qeijj4YyEIkmou7N0gYD5w.text: On the positive side, this place was much more child friendly than I expected. The waitresses gave our 3 grandchildren placemats & crayons as soon as we arrived. There were also plenty of menu options for the boys--hot dogs & shrimp among them.  On the negative side, my mahi mahi was so overcooked it was tasteless & my steamed broccoli was cold when it got to the table. My husband fared better with his fettuccini with crab.  Another big downer was the location. Having a restaurant in a strip mall isn't a good sign.

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. The grilled mahi mahi was a miss.

NgJZO4b0QUoRfZrg7Bcd0w.text: This is a hidden gem in Bridgeville, actually the Pittsburgh area. The atmosphere is absolutely beautiful ( waterfalls, fire pits, beach and sand area, etc) and makes you feel like you're on an island vacation! Our waitress, Carla, was very attentive and made sure my mom's first visit was special. I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. The outside eating area view.

i3cOMAAm6Ta-06qIX-_dqw.text: So three tries and they are out. They just don't give a f@#$.  Every thing is half ass precooked and might be warmed up but not the Macncheese had to ask to have it warmed up. Peel and eat were mush and tasted like the bottom of of the bucket from a week ago. Chicken breast dryed out and bland. Ordered the burger medium came well.  We gave this place 3 chances and it has only got worse. We even switched up on times and days of the week.  Bright points the wait staff work their was off to make you happy too bad the kitchen takes a dump on them.  I would expect food this sucking to suck at 1/4 the prices they are charging.

LatFpFielR-nttvL5mwXzQ.text: The only reason I can justify one star is because the bartenders made a fantastic Mule.   Our waitstaff, I believe her name was Caroline, was super rude and not approachable. She treated our table of 4 like we were an inconvenience to her.   We also had to get our own silverware, and tell the table next to us (that had the same waitress) where to get theirs.  Her demeanor was completely standoffish. My friend ordered a side salad, and we had to ask 2-3 times for her food to come out (after the 3 of us had our food). She just assumed that my friend needed to eat her salad before she got her food.  Our food was not great. My burger was raw, my fries undercooked, and my friends chicken were all over cooked and nearly inedible. It was evident that our food had sat under the heat lamp for an extended period of time. Their slaw with their chicken was wilted... WILTED AND BROWN.  We asked to speak with manager, to address aforementioned issues. The manager was not any better. He was rude to us, because evidently we're an inconvenience. He cut us off when we were trying to explain our frustrations. He rudely advised us that if we had a problem with our food, we should have told our waitress and he'd fix it. Well, it would help if the waitress came back once to ask us how our food was.  Tables next to us with a different waitstaff were treated respectfully. They also were seated after us, and got their food before us, and paid/left before us.  It took our waitress 3 attempts at giving us the correct bills.   This is why restaurants need to drug test employees.... I'd be better off getting a burger from Burger King...   We waited over 20 minutes for our checks. We will never be back.  We had to pay our tabs at the bar because our waitress ignored us!

GT685JYkCcIzm648l8l9EQ.text: This was my first visit to Rumfish in years and I was impressed.  There seems to be new management and new menu.  I recommend the crabdip and fish tacos   Great atmosphere..great service and great food!

hCnYceebig5G9YNxnZ5Hrw.text: When we first came in the host(that turned out to be the manager)told my friend that we gave a fake name and were probably good critics.  Next the waitress was slow with our food. We then were brought out bill it was incorrect. The waitress could not make the correction or resolve the matter. The manager "John" came to the table and said "what?" He then was rude to my friend who was celebrating her birthday.  He continued being rude to our party of 10 women. I will never go back there again.

PcCqL6RxfdRwB7NwM8gUdg.text: Service was great, I think Lisa.  Salad was so weak, just lettuce carrots and cucumber.  Dressings were ok.  Peel and eat shrimp tiny and almost going bad.  Jambalaya had 3 mussels, no shrimp, no clams.  My dads crab cake was decent and drink was decent.  For $70 plus for a lunch for 2 there are far better choices.  I won't be back.  They aren't gonna last another year.  The rent there has to be crazy high it's a huge space.  The food was worth $30-$40 tops. We could have ate at Eddie V or Morton's for the same if not cheaper for far superior food.

WtzMCDNSof_VFU3R6ziN1w.text: Like most people have said, the outdoor area is pretty cool. We sat at one of the outdoor bars and had a drink then tried to order food. By tried they said you can only eat at the other bar when they have an outdoor grill going. Ok, so we had to walk the 20 feet to the other bar to eat. I didn't really get that, but no biggie.  Food was decent and the service was ok. The atmosphere was not really what I was expecting. It went from a restaurant to club complete with a DJ in no time flat. I guess that's cool if that's what you are into. I just wasn't prepared for techno with my cheeseburger! I give it 3 stars, it's not bad just not what I'm into.
