XRzEDicam5y9wsl4BffnSg.text: Excellent service with good food.  I planned a surprise night out for my pregnant wife and friends.  I called to make a reservation and was connected to their general manager.  John was very accommodating as he set us up in their private room.  Ashley, our server, did an excellent job navigating 4 kids and 9 adults.  Burgers were great and the beer selection was on point.  We will definitely be back!

Q9AUdNWjXLKLfWCMkKfDRw.text: Mr Miyagi likes the Sushi!  I went last night - second time.    They have a huge outdoor area - I recommend for all yelpers who want a cheap happy hour to experience it while the weather is permitting.   The place does get crazy toward the evening.  Getting Hungry - I headed to the inside for a meal.   I was concerned because of reviews when they first opened up.  I did recognize the Sushi Chef and decided to jump in.  The Sushi was awesome.   The fish was fresh (I had a variety salmon, tuna, octopus, shrimp).   The sushi bar and staff behind the sushi bar (one doing sushi and one doing oysters) provided a lot of interactions and opportunities to try their product.  The only minor knock was the wait staff seemed a little overwhelm at times.  Great Experience - I will go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Tempura pancake filled with sautéed vegetables and A high Tuna.  I heard the Chef is moving to Monterey Bay in March.
Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. I will just simply say: Oh My!   - this was the best thing I have tasted yet
Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. I will call is the flowers of fish eggs followed by rolls of greatness

9m3a4awGd3MZLhsPWBwzZg.text: Had a great dinner the other night. The scallops were seared perfectly and perfectly cooked. I loved the tomato risotto, it was so flavorful. My friend had the grilled tuna which he said was great and he really liked the lime aioli. As much as we liked the food, it was our server, Hallie, who really made our meal. She was very friendly and attentive without being overbearing.

Bt_BSYmsHasgE0A_RDa4Nw.text: Disappointed. First they messed up the order, second the chicken was over cooked and burnt. Third checkout took so much time. For a pricy restaurant, we felt Wendy's is better.

BhfFKgKfGFhaMnHSUbkwPA.text: Went on a Wednesday evening and sat in the bar area for the happy hour app special. Ordered the peel and eat shrimp. They came out with a weird smell and discovered they were spoiled. So repulsive. To boot -- the manager never even came out to apologize or check if our other food was ok. This place has gone downhill since we were last there. We won't be back!

uPK_Ku-MvNDUJa0UpcgHTw.text: I love it there. Never had A bad time or meal. I always try an ask for my favorite server Jenna Salerno. Very competent an sweet. I go at least 2 times a month.

FELMXh2h9IvbXBRhWwtrgw.text: Ordered on the yelp app for pickup. Phoned restaurant to confirm the order was received. The girl who answered apologized and said she hung up on the person from yelp/eat24 because she didn't know what it was. Why make this a feature in your establishment if you don't properly train your staff on how to manage it.

u1fW8zTLLJv5-g9E4y2ZLg.text: This is my second time coming to Rumfish, and after the first time we knew we needed to come back. While the service isn't always the fastest, the food was amazing! The Ahi Tuna was really good and came with a really good roasted corn aioli. The crab dip was AMAZING but we got the bigger size this time ($15 compared to the smaller one for $8) and it was not worth it. It was mostly bread, the same amount of dip and half our chips were stale. Overall, the food is very good but because of the slow service sometimes and the dip I wouldn't highly recommend. --Edit-- I tried to come here again for a quit but one night, we got there a little before they closed and asked when they're kitchen closed, she told us the time and said they were closed even tho we got there before they were closing. Probably won't go back. Management needs to step up

yXZ8Qfa71d5HlY7-hkp0Uw.text: My friends and I went to Rumfish on Cinco de Mayo. My friend called earlier that day and was able to make a reservation for 10 for the same evening. When we arrived, they sat us at a bar that was over looking the kitchen. There was no alcohol served at this bar. The place is huge, but it was also empty. We asked if we could sit at a nicer table close to the bar or close to outside and the waitress said absolutely not, because every other table has been "reserved for weeks." Well we were there all night, and not one of those reservations showed up. Crazy right?! Also, Rumfish has so many rules and regulations, I thought I was in elementary school again lol the bar over looking the kitchen didn't have alcohol. It's a BAR. and the bars outside didn't let you order food. If you were seated inside you were given glasses, but forbidden to walk on the patio with it lol. It was just weird and didn't really seem necessary.  Ok, on to the food! The $5 fish tacos were a STEAL! You got 2 in an order and I thought they were fabulous! However, they are $14 regular price and that's a total rip off. My husband got the burger with pulled pork on top and he really enjoyed it. It came with a side of fries. The fries and burger was a really nice portion, but it better be because it was $16! The menu was pretty pricey.  I thought the food was great, and I can say that I will be back to enjoy some sunshine with my cocktails

58ovNF8ZwWXONuPzsy10yQ.text: Eh.   Food is bland and boring and most likely it comes in frozen and is reheated or fried.  Service borders on ok to completely unacceptable.  Crowd is even worse; annoying suburbanites and their broods. But what's one to expect when in this type of area that doesn't have many choices?   Once was more than enough.

QEVGszAej_sTgAkvszPjpA.text: I don't write 1 star reviews unless we have more than one bad experience...  We will not be becoming back this this restaurant ever! Every single time we come here, we have awful experiences. Our food either isn't cooked well , the bill isn't right , or the food comes out an hour later. The experience today was by the the worst. My boyfriend ordered the shrimp appetizer and it literally took 45 minutes to get it.  The group was there having dinner and drinks before, so he ordered it to go.. Our sever "checked" on it and found it had been sitting in the fridge for 20 minutes. It had been sitting out for 25 minute it's then in the fridge for 20... My boyfriend already paid for the food so he wouldn't not take it. I wish we could give 0 stars  because that is what this place deserves it .

LDj23lX10xLli2GOULdfvw.text: Overpriced and food is gross.  Outside atmosphere is wonderful, if they allow you out there.  Its always pretty empty but we have been told we cant sit out there.

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Pretty awful food.  Extremely overpriced. No seating outside.  Yet no one there.  Shrimp mushy.  Brussels burnt. Gross.

YQPyajcL9heB4ZBUzyDICw.text: Paradise tucked away in a shopping plaza!  Coming here makes me forget I'm in Pittsburgh and makes me feel like I'm on a beach vacation. If you come early you can enjoy a meal and relax. If you come later in the evening they usually get a pretty decent crowd and frequently have a band or a DJ. Definitely worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Drink menu side 2
Photo of Rumfish Grille - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Drink menu side 1

3U7XHiQajpboQGvB00XCAw.text: As a night club, Rumfish is great. Beach atmosphere in Bridgeville PA! Great music, surprisingly expensive drinks, but its pretty up-scale so its to be expected.  However, as a restaurant, it feels almost like they are playing a trick on you. Like "How much can we possibly charge for mediocre food and take as long as possible with people getting up and walking out?" The $26 for a Salmon Salad? Roasted Red potatoes that we hard as a rock despite asking them to be cooked 3 times (then clearly just microwaved till they were somehow both rock hard and a puddle of slime). And the service took... just forever. Im normally not one to complain about anything, but Rumfish should stick to what they do well and scrap the restaurant as a whole. Not just forgettable but actually a BAD memory.

p6paJRXN7-W276hxBpxjZQ.text: Went out to dinner here for a friend's birthday had the spicy shrimp as an appetizer it was very good we also had the fish tacos we're just as good the service was great and then we wandered outside to the outdoor bar had a few more drinks overall had a great experience

lxToUcjJgaNm8LHA1qLNIg.text: I love how it looks and the outdoor area is awesome for the summer. However the cost of the food compared to what you get is ridiculous. You can get salmon at any other place for a lot cheaper. The menu is also very small.

Gct0eFoJD-Y-qgmKV5VsWw.text: Food is overpriced for the quality. We ordered the Jerk Chicken Pasta ($18) which was flavorless and the Clam Chowder which was greasy. Other entrees were upwards of $30 and I'm so glad I didn't get one of them because it could not have been good either.  We got some appetizers from the Happy Hour menu as well and they were fine. Crab dip, fish tacos, and calamari ($5-$6 each during happy hour). Didn't have a problem with the quality of the price but they weren't anything special. Calamari was certainly frozen prior to being warmed up to serve. Fish tacos could have used some more flavor. Crab dip was probably the best of the bunch, but still just so-so.   Our waitress was nice and attentive, but I do want to note that it was not busy at all.   Ambiance of the place is cool. They have a big outside patio area and it's all nautical/tropical themed, but way out of place in a Pittsburgh suburb.   I would never recommend this place to anyone. Much better options around the area.  If you're in the area however and want to check out their happy hour specials, sure why not. Just don't order any entrees and don't expect anything great.   Two stars instead of one for the Happy Hour menu and theme.

LfEo772XU3N565fUkp599g.text: I went here for a friends birthday dinner and was not pleased with the service of the place. I like the space.  The environment and the live music was great. The outdoor space was awesome and fun. But the service is the reason i will not be returning and this is why:  1. The server was nowhere to be found for long periods of time. (Not sure if they were understaffed or if she had tables inside too.) To the point where i salked up to thebar to order.  2. I was denied being served a product (which i had already located behind the bar by perusing myself).  The bartender told my server that they didn't have the product. (Clearly didn't take the time to look and just denied a guest what they were asking for.)  The server came back to relay the message to me and told me that the bottle i saw must have been empty on the shelf.  I walked up to the bar and showed the bartenders where the bottle was. After this ordeal of ignorance i did get my tequila, woo!   3. The price of the tequila (i found with no warning from any of the staff) for one ounce was $14.00. That is 1 oz of Casamigos Relosado for $14. That bottle cost $52 in a pa wines and spirits store. This means that this place is making damn near $300 off of that one bottle that i, at first, was denied.  4. I asked for a manager and was not very understanding at all. His response to me about the ordeal was that his bartender didn't see it and he affirmed that the price for one ounce of Casamigos Reposado was indeed $14 and the coust of a double was $28. At that point i just asked for my check. He walked away and never returned. [Poor service on a managerial level as well.]  5. To top it off i used the womens room outside and not one toilet paper roll nor paper towel roll was in the dispenser. Also, there was litrally no trashcan. Just a pile of dirty paper towels on the counterspace.

FqVLeEt-eogGO8eaj9gfpA.text: It's a nice spot to have some drinks and sit outside. Good happy hour. Excellent, friendly service. The food is a bit better than I thought it would be but I agree with others that most entrees are overpriced. A crabcake entree at that that price point should have more crab than filler, but the sides were outstanding. We also ordered pulled-pork nachos and I have to say I was shocked (but not all that mad) that the cheese on the nachos was the cheese sauce one gets at a ballpark rather than real cheese. The pulled pork was overly sauced and way too sweet.

D5iU-6-9ivU66QI02w9e5w.text: Awesome spot! Didn't expect much from a place in a strip mall. The food was delicious and tasty. I got the pineapple glaze salmon. Super yummy!!  The outdoor area gave me a very beachy vibe. Plenty of seating and drinks to keep everyone entertained.

GqEP-f2CtFlfDsLRpPrrzA.text: I took a friend there for a belated birthday dinner. We arrived to find that they were out of all but one of their Pepsi drinks. Like, is that so you have to drink water or their expensive cocktails?   We ordered the nachos as a an appetizer, she had tacos and i order fish and chips. the fish was greasy, which made the fries it was sitting on greasier. There seemed to only be meat in the nachos on one side and the meat that was in the nachos was rock hard. I tapped it with my nails and my friend heard it thinking I was hitting the plate. I tried a piece and it was leather. At $14 a piece I was highly disappointed. We both regretted not just going to the pizza shop in the same plaza.

cA3chlsDIssEz1mCeGFkQA.text: I have been to Rumfish a handful of times for a fun place to go on a summer night. Their outdoor area has comfortable couches, fire pits, and awesome music. With two bars and waitresses and waiters walking around, it's easy to get drinks. Most recently, my friends (a group of 11) started outside but decided we wanted to sit inside and the waitresses were really accommodating and got us a table. I started off with a Liquid Haze mixed drink. It was made with Malibu rum, Captain Morgan and Melon liquor. It was really delicious and a little tart. My friend and I split two appetizers. We had the Buffalo chicken egg rolls and crab dip. Both were great! The egg rolls were interesting to me but I'd get them again. The group was overall satisfied and we had a great waitress, Larissa, who was very patient when it came time for us to pay! I enjoy coming here for a night out with friends!

xcKHRQfR4lYpwlZhQvTOog.text: Forgot to post my review from a few weeks ago....I went in for restaurant week totally prepared to get the restaurant week dinner special but we ended up just ordering off the menu and left paying less than the price of one of those dinner specials for the both of us!    The place is huge, service was good (our server was peppy and friendly), prices were reasonable and the food was good.  Big menu with a variety of foods to pick from.   I got a burger which was huge and cooked perfectly AND (bonus!) was able to get Mac n cheese as my side - yummmmmm!!!! My hubby got a fish sandwich which was apparently good because I didn't even get a chance to nibble it before it was all gone. However, he claims he was just hungry.  We got dessert to go which was actually very tasty.    Overall, it wasn't 'so awesome I can't wait to come again' good but would definitely go again for a solid meal that's not too pricey.

HRHgL-Svxim1OroZlolMEw.text: Drink from the bar was too sweet and food too greasy. Everything was greasy. Service was a little slow as well and they weren't even busy. It appeared that they have nice Friday and Saturday entertainment. May give them another try on one of those occasions.

8HVRtkigW-lqBcOzoPosyA.text: My group of 13 coworkers ate at here for lunch to celebrate someone's last day. They were really accommodating to our large group and everyone enjoyed their food. The wait staff was very attentive, checking on everyone multiple times and made sure we had plenty of water on the tables since it was a hot day. My only complaint was that when I called to make the reservation for our group, whoever answered the phone told me she could not personally take the reservation, however, a manager would call me back to do so. I never heard from the manager and had to call the morning of to make sure we were okay to come in. Probably just a miscommunication. The decor both inside and out is really cool. I will be returning in the future. Overall good experience.

vuiws-aeXARqSqU-P5Lung.text: We had dinner tonight at Rumfish with friends. It was their idea. I don't understand who their target audience is, but it's not me. It was half empty at prime time Saturday night. However, the food and service were decent. We had drinks after dinner in the 'beach' area. The only wine available was the house jug stuff - nasty. But the surroundings were pretty nice. Overall, it's not the place for me, but not the worst experience. Food and service were acceptable.

YRQNdza-hVn7yxMYjP2Epg.text: First, with the positives. The service was great! Our waitress, Beckey was wonderful. My husband had the swordfish that was really good. I had the seared scallops that were also good. Although, the sear could have been more prominent. The negatives..I wasn't a fan of their dinner rolls, they were rock hard. The dinner salad was really skimpy for the 7 bucks I paid. It was just spring mix, shredded carrots, and diced tomatoes that were not farm fresh. Also, a lot of fruit flies which I hate. If there were half stars I would have given a 3 1/2 because of the great service.

1ZRiY7dNpFym_UZnro8T6g.text: A disappointing update to my previous review. My husband and I visited recently, and we were severely disappointed with our experience.   The first thing I noticed when we arrived during happy hour was that the place was nearly empty. The staff was pretty much standing around, even though the place looked like it could use some cleaning. It was also EXTREMELY hot indoors. On a 90 day, the doors to the outdoor patio and bar area were wide open, and there were giant noisy fans blowing any cool air from inside out toward the bar. It was warm and stuffy, to the point that my husband asked if the air conditioner was broken. The hostess stated that it was just warm because of the overhead doors being open to the outside. We were seated at a table that looked like it had been wiped with a dirty rag. It was off-putting, but I just wiped it down further with a napkin. Since the doors were wide open, flies were happily buzzing around indoors. This persisted during our meal, and was quite annoying.   The next disappointment came in finding out that they changed the menu, and it is extremely different now. At some point they discontinued serving sushi - which was one of the highlights of a previous visit. They also no longer have the coconut chicken appetizer that we both loved, nor the pork loin or seafood pasta that we ordered. When asked, the server recommended either the buffalo chicken egg rolls or the pulled pork nachos as appetizers. Maybe its just me, but I don't think egg rolls or pulled pork nachos when I go to a seafood place.   We settled on the pulled pork nachos and the drunken mussels. The nachos were decent, the amount of toppings were sufficient, but the pork was just average. The cheese reminded me a stadium cheese. They definitely werent anything to write home about.   The drunken mussels were pretty average. The portion was average, the garlic white wine sauce was underwhelming, and the ridiculously large pieces of garlic-cheese bread that was served with it seemed out of place. They weren't the worst mussels I've had, but they also weren't anywhere near the best. Sadly, this was pretty much the highlight of our meal.  Since the seafood options on the revamped menu left much to be desired, both my husband and I settled on the Beachside Chicken, which is described as "Grilled jerked chicken breast, island slaw, yellow rice & pineapple aioli". I asked for my pineapple aioli on the side, since I wasn't certain I'd like it.   Our meals arrived and the chicken was a joke. It was, by my estimation, a 3 or 4oz chicken breast, filleted into 2 pieces. The blackening seasoning was tasty, but since the chicken breasts were so small, the ratio of seasoning to meat was a bit overwhelming. The yellow rice, was literally, just yellow rice. It could have come out of a box. The "island slaw" was essentially cabbage, a few slivers of bell pepper, and what tasted like soy sauce. There was nothing "island" about it, and, to me, it just wasn't good. My husband did like the pineapple aioli, but it tasted "artificial" as opposed to being made with fresh pineapple. I ended up asking for a side of mango salsa, which ended up being my favorite part of the dish. I mixed it into the rice, which livened it up, and also dumped it onto my sad little chicken breasts. The mango salsa is what this dish needs to be cohesive. And, for god sake, stop butchering tiny chicken breast like this!   Including 3 drinks our meal came to $78 and change. Thank god I had purchased a voucher on the local "Just Pay Half" website, giving us a $50 credit at the cost of $25. Since alcohol isn't included, we still ended up paying about $51 for this meal, including the voucher cost. My husband and I both agrees that even that was overpriced for what we got. We will not be going back to Rumfish Grill, and I will be surprised if the business makes it another year or more.

lK98K8jJsV1mGTy8yD7qQQ.text: Really mixed feelings on Rumfish. The ambiance is amazing.. a whole beachy compound all whilst being located in a strip mall in Bridgeville. Nice lighting. They paid out for nice decor and it shows. The food is okay to good, but not exceptional. The seafood stew sauce is awesome, but the seafood is often overcooked. Many fish dishes are good, but sometimes you get the sense your dish has been sitting under a heat lamp for a little too long. I like the food enough to return, but the service has been pretty offputting more than once. My mother and father in law came to town, so we took them to Rumfish for dinner. Our server was just bizarre for lack of a better term. He talked at us a minute, stopped back wayyy too often and started rambling completely unprompted about his personal life - like weird oversharing types of things - while we all sat there uncomfortably, even rested his hand on my father in laws shoulder at one point... super weird. He was sweating a whole lot. Really twitchy - just seemed entirely drugged up. We literally were not even able to talk to each other for more than a minute at a time without him returning to talk at us. We shoveled our meals in and left in a hurry. Probably would have spent more money on drinks if not for the weird, weird service situation. Seems like their service is a common complaint on here. With a wait staff that includes that guy, I understand why.

ASMj1u_XbWK27KiMQ0-_mA.text: Atmosphere is very good, the outside bar will be amazing and finished soon. Lobster roll was delicious- I had the scallops but they were drowning in soy sauce and not that good. I think the local owners are very open to ideas and change so I think down the road it will take off as a good place to eat. Portions were pretty small for the money however- needs to be improved.

HvRnXC8Pv8A1xqH94a6ybw.text: Love the outside bar!!  They need to get some live bands playing reggae.  Went inside to eat, though, and had lousy service & overpriced oysters $3 a piece. Really??!!

V8o13dB_ylhuGfD10dddTg.text: First time guests my fiance and I heard great things about Rumfish Grille. When we got there our expectations were exceeded. We were lead to a great table with an equally exciting atmosphere.  Their menu was unique, but at the same time everyone could find something they enjoy.  We did not experience the outside section, just the indoor restaurant area but we would definitely return. Also, check apps for discounts.  We got 15% off using the LoyalTree app.

6dGNmYypcFqPFJqpmWtGSQ.text: This is becoming my favorite seafood restaurant in the area. We were there for dinner last night and my wife and I had oysters on the half shell, steamed clams, grilled octopus (I had been craving this since the last time I ate here), and the king crab dinner. All of the dishes were excellent. We were seated next to the open kitchen so we could even watch them prepare our food, which was great, and the head chef even walked over to our table after we were finished eating to ask how it was.

kO7le8FEelKt7d99fxFwrQ.text: My husband and I have been here 5 times since they have opened and we have had a really great meal to an even greater meal.  Fresh prepared fish with an open kitchen.  Every time I go, I start with the ceviche.  The preparation is a little different than I'm used to (much bigger chunks of fish), but always great.  On our last trip my husband ordered peel and eat shrimp, whole lobster, mac and cheese and fingerling potatoes.  All were exceptional, although I didn't get to taste his lobster, he wasn't sharing.  My grandson got the tuna steak and risotto with Ponzu sauce. It came perfectly prepared.  I was going to try the tuna also, but was enticed when she said they had a salmon special.  A little pricey, but so worth it.  It was simply excellent.  We have never been disappointed.  Each time our meals have been prepared exactly as ordered and very flavorful.  Service and atmosphere are also first class.  Seems as though attention to detail is very important. On our last visit, we sat near the open kitchen, and were pleased to see how the expediter took such care in the food that was sent out.  I would definitely recommend Rumfish Grille for the fish lovers out there.

9AVThAWwOYHcndQnDnmCwA.text: This is a fun place to go in the summer for the cabana bar out back. They have a dance "floor" (translation: sandy area) with a DJ and two outdoor bars, firepits, cabana style seating, direct TV for the Pirates games, nightly drink specials, and frozen drinks. It is a good place to hang out with your friends on a Friday or Saturday and chill out. I wouldn't come here for the food. You have to go inside the restaurant to eat. The service is haphazard and I had to wait forever for someone to take my order at the sushi bar (this was after waiting at the regular bar inside where I was completely ignored). They are grossly understaffed and the mixture of indoor bar, outdoor bars, sushi bar, and indoor dining room makes for one hot mess when it comes to finding a server. I had a shrimp po boy sandwich and I wouldn't recommend it. It barely had any shrimp and what were on there were tiny popcorn shrimp that were tough and had obviously come out of a frozen food bag and been microwaved. My hand cut fries were decent, but lukewarm and slightly soggy. I'll go back over the summer, but just for the drinks and the atmosphere.

LYk-4h4nq58YAxtMwH41jg.text: Loved it!  Food was great!  Had the salmon and veggies.  Fresh and delicious!

zSoIfIDqoQMXiV3P-rBvrg.text: Great food and service. My wife and I will be back soon.

yRe3a-WTc4Y3jTVE3ysTug.text: I Love the atmosphere but the food is average and overpriced. I really feel like they should rethink the menu. On one hand they are set up for a party bar, with the outside bars, the stage and on the other hand they are trying to have a high-end menu with bland food. Also, they only have 4 or 5 suggestions for mixed drinks on the menu. What about a martini list or fun frozen drinks? I think this would work with more casual food choices to go with the party bar atmosphere. I will go there for drinks but not going back for dinner.

4owgl_ZC-TjezOUJbnNY_w.text: Chef has a great vision and food is delicious.  Will keep going back to this fun addition to Bridgeville.   Still working out some kinks with respect to service, as expected for just having opened a couple of weeks ago.  Loved the ice cream sandwich dessert and the chocolate cake was outstanding.  Sophisticate design.  Just what we needed!

eKu0hzX3HSy340yMvaC_VA.text: I decided to write a review because I've read more negative than positive comments. My experience with dinner this past Saturday (4th of July weekend) with 2 of my closest friends was awesome! We were seated quickly (we arrived around 8pm), it was still very crowded, especially outdoors, but our waitress was very nice, even when 2 of us at the last minute decided we changed our minds on what we wanted to have for dinner. We had mussels and poutine for appetizers (a weird combination, I know, but still they were both very good). It was my first time eating mussels; I don't typically like seafood but I found myself liking them a lot. The three of us did the create your own entree, all of us had the salmon, a veggie, and we all decided to go with the mac and cheese as our additional side, which was THE BEST MAC AND CHEESE I HAVE EVER HAD. IT was creamy, cheesy and full of flavor! Honestly, no complaints and would go back in a heart beat.

S7DyacKrBE_GrdDXCmM3OA.text: This place is a FARCE. Rumfish must be overseen by a bunch of imbeciles, with no one having a clue how to run a restaurant effectively. How on earth do you run out of practically every protein on the menu, or glasses, and plates all the way down to the bread? This restaurant has been opened for a year and one would have thought it was their first night of operation. It is beyond my understanding how it is still in operation today. I visited on Saturday and the food is simply mediocre and I waited 20 minutes for a glass of beer, yes, my friends, 20 minutes. I was told the bartender was new, although I could see 5 of them serving drinks. I would have loved to quench my thirst with a glass of water, but was told by my waitress that they had run of glasses! Haha! When it came time to order my dinner, I had planned on ordering the Mahi Mahi, but they were out. What else was unavailable from the menu you ask? Monkfish, catfish, duck, both beef protein and several sides? How embarrassing, whomever is responsible for inventory needs re-trained. What a joke, we would have been better off going to Long John Silver's. Please People, do yourselves a favor and avoid this place at all cost. Terrible food, absentee ownership whom obviously has no desire in providing the residents of the South Hills community an acceptable dining experience. Summer is approaching, and the outside area is probably their only saving grace. Perhaps they should re-think their concept. RUN, RUN away from RUNfish grille.

sRCoESW2_0Fm5id_7Bknvg.text: Bad location, worse food and poor service. Kind of funny... A "meat market" specializing in seafood!! I give it one more year then done.

llRLtghBDzvcO4YlPzpnMQ.text: I went here for lunch last week and dinner last night.  Good both times.  The lunch menu has more options and is easier on your wallet.  The atmosphere for a warm summer night is amazing. I am anxious to go here on a Saturday night before it gets too cold outside.  The fire pits will keep you warm.    So for lunch my fiance and I split two meals so that we could try them both, I ordered the Smoked Salmon BLT.  Very good and served with your choice of a side.  I was impressed with the variety of options they offered for sides including some healthy options such as summer squash and quinoa.  My fiance ordered the Fish and Chips which was also good.  The batter it was cooked in was crispy and had a nice taste and not too oily.  The fries were also good.  To premise this, I eat Fish and Chips almost every place I go and I'm picky about it.  This place was way better than Pipers Pub.    For dinner last night, I had the scallops and asian noodle dish.  The scallops were perfectly cooked and wonderful, although a little on the salty side, but I heart salt so I liked it.  The noodles were mixed with some veggies and nicely flavored.  Good hot or cold.  (I'm eating my leftover noodles right now as I type this cold, YUM!)  My friend had the crabcakes.  I ate a bite of hers and it was also very good.  Can't complain whatsoever about the food  Every dish thus far has been good.  We sat at the bar and had an attentive waitress last night (but this was 8:30 at night).  And I was offered a glass for my beer!  Both times I have been there it was not slammed.  So maybe I have been lucky (considering other service reviews), or maybe they are stepping up their service game.  Either way, I'll def be back for food as well as fun.

CKDs9uiHrMQTWL6y4bXfKA.text: After a friend spoke highly of the restaurant, my wife and I decided to try it.  Night didn't start out so great.  We were seated at a fairly dark table near the bar. Had to use our cell phone to read the menu.  After about 10 minutes of no one coming to our table, we flagged down someone who turned out to be the asst. manager.  He was very pleasant and apologetic and said he personally would be working our table.  The peel and eat shrimp appetizer was very good.  Although, we could have used a bit more cocktail sauce right off the bat.  I'm sure more was there for the asking.  Could have also used more napkins and a hand towelette.  Wife had the pasta with four vegetables.  It smelled fantastic, had plenty of veggies, and was flavorful.  I had the pork with apples.  Excellent.  The mix of apples and cranberries was perfect.  Except for the slow start, we were pleased with the night overall and definitely will return.

bKTrV2weJ19uzvvYMO28gQ.text: The first time I went there for dinner they "ran out of food" never heard of such a thing.   I decided to give it another try - our waitress was absolutely clueless. Besides getting our drinks (after waiting 10 minutes for her to acknowledge us) she didn't do anything. Our food was brought out by the food runners (which is fine) but our waitress never once came back to ask if we needed anything or to just see how we were doing. We were served our mussels with no side plate so my boyfriend and I both had to eat over the shell plate. I got the peri peri mixed grill and it tasted like they poured the entire bottle of seasoning on my food. Later that night I got sick. Not worth an $80+ bill...do not go for the food  On the other hand, the outside is very beautiful. I would suggest you go to rumfish only for the social atmosphere - drinks and hanging with friends. Just expect to spend money $$$$$

2a5qeBw4ERq3UZ88oRAcTQ.text: While the food was good and the outside area was nice it didn't make up for the service. There were 2 people beside me there at the time and it took nearly a half hour for my drink. I ended up being there for nearly three hours when I probably didn't even spend half that time eating. I tried it a second time and I had the same results, good food, bad service. If the service was improved, I would recommend it, but as is, I wouldn't.

yJ_XEvcaJ7N1M-FA9enMTA.text: Gross, gross, gross! It has an amazing atmosphere, especially for the location. I will give it that. But it was dirty. Our waiter was untrained and slow. The hostess (while attractive) was wearing skintight short-shorts and no bra! I actually saw another waiter picking his nose (gag). 'Something' was going on in the only stall in the men's room when my husband tried to take my son to the bathroom (?). And the food was iffy. I will never go back.   Just yucky. I cannot believe the number of good reviews for this dump. The only positive was the cheap bill, but who cares. Stay away.

LrWHjNeFAOCyGWP9V-mJBw.text: This place is fairly new and needs a little time to get used to all the business they are going to get. The outside bar and patio is phenomenal!!! They have bands play and fire pits with comfy seating. 2 bars outside and one bar in/outside. The fish tacos are awesome! Very flavorful. No food service outdoors, but a grill type menu will be arriving soon (like pork on the grill). Very limited on what alcohol can be served outdoors. No glassware permitted, so if you want a glass of wine...that's right...it will come to you in a plastic cup. The servers we have had so far actually remembered us, which is always a gold star in my book! Somewhat pricey for what you get, but it is a nice ambiance and the outdoor space really grabs my attention. I can't wait to return on a day a band plays.

cO6_KiOOXkeFmUkbZBvwMA.text: I love the atmosphere, the big wine glasses and the oysters..just YUM. The first time we went, the meal wasn't too good - the Mahi-mahi was super dry - but we gave Rumfish a second chance and the Salmon, roasted cauliflower and mac and cheese were all amazing.

xJePJX9UYk7O1lvoz8Fm5A.text: I'm giving 3 stars because of the last time I ate at Rumfish, which was also the last time I was there. The food we were served was entirely too salty and we had to send the fish back because it was inedible. I think the prices are too high for the quality you get. But I will say that I adore their outside area, it is so beautiful in the summer and is a nice place to have drinks with friends. Service was always good in my previous experience so that's a plus.

EiD-YVBuLqU5Oml5Hb3N8A.text: Horrible. Overpriced garbage making you pay for the ambiance. Lack of security w many fights. Cater to bikers. One night I was there the singer for the night was attacked and beaten by a random person. security did very little and what was done was done too late. Went twice will never be fooled again

v6a2dI3r4p3nb5MI9g7KNg.text: The only place I can remember going were I and my party left hungry I am in the resteraunt business and know my seafood Overpriced meals that are not very good even to look at The place looks fantastic but I wont be back Did not even ask about the raw bar Very disapointing Dont waste your time

W4SCSEn9NxNlGu8uXi_ylQ.text: I have been here a couple times. The first time was good. The swordfish is pretty good, however if you order any other fish you will be greatly disappointed. For the prices here I would rather spend a little extra and go to Monterrey Bay or Off the Hook where I know I will get an amazing meal. This place has been hit or miss, never does it provide the same experience as I had before. I gave it three chances and this past Friday was the absolute worst. We went out for my sisters birthday and at what should be the peak of dinner rush, 16 of us were able to get a table right away. Which was awesome but at the same time made me wonder why this place was not busy. We ordered waters, were brought seltzer water... Ever take a huge sip of that expecting it to be something else? Not pleasant at all. Then we received our $9 beers which were warm. Half of us ordered the lobster bisque because I had it before and thought it was so good, one of their best dishes. We received them and it was watery, very very fishy and just not at all what I have had on previous nights there. We had to send it back it was that bad, I never send food back. Finally when we all received our entrees, I had ordered the "jumbo" scallops. I received what they call jumbo but in actuality was bay scallops somewhere between small and medium size. My mashed potatoes that I received with my meal where like they had been sitting under the heating lamp too long and formed a hard shell over them. The broccoli was bland with no seasoning or butter for taste. Not one person in my party had a good meal that they would say was worth the price.  While the outdoor area is very nice it did not make up for the meal that was served. I will never be going back to this place.  I recommend if you are looking for a nice fish dinner to spend the extra cash and go to Monterrey bay or off the hook  in warrendale.  You would probably get a better meal at Red Lobster at least they are pretty consistent with the food.

oX81IbCEu3L-Gg2AINi5lw.text: Service isn't that great. Hold off till they get that fixed.

zjOtLlfaketV9v8DyxviRQ.text: Unfortunately the only thing Rumfish has going for it is the outside bar. The drink selection is OK, but the food is surprisingly bad for how much it costs.  Especially avoid the seafood stew. I mean, Pittsburgh generally isn't the best place for seafood, but this place really sets the bar low. Too much salt, too overcooked, shellfish tasting spoiled, etc.

3ClxIFkv-yNDx9fBKhV8sw.text: Would recommend and Enjoyed the dinner. Good menu with a mix of food options. Our party had a mix of seafood and meat and enjoyed the meal. Drinks are ole try and the atmosphere is great with both in and outdoor seating. Only issue is that we wanted to go to the beach area later and there was a cover charge and after what we spent on dinner (good amount) it should be complimentary.  Service was on the mark. Have fun!

0R81zzCUj_8iX5Kzlb07-w.text: What an amazing place.  Great atmosphere inside and once you step outside, .......WOW!!!!  The food was perfect, as was our server Brian

PHGIrC-mSAxYnpr4tdhrWA.text: I haven't had food here, but I came in to talk to a manager and was rudely told that no manager could talk to me by the manager. It would probably be a good idea to respect guests. Good luck with your location.

9-LQIJOWeB3gTW6x8OCe0w.text: I'm surprised by all the negative reviews I've seen on here.  I tried rumfish for the first time tonight and it was delicious.  Our server, Harry, was on point, informative, attentive, and gave us some top notch serving. I ordered the chicken with goat cheese, and the portion was huge!  My friend got the crab cakes and they were super tasty, as well!

AHoQM8q-MkMc0QHK1-ibIQ.text: Excellent location for dinner with friends in the south hills!  All of the seafood options were delicious, including the crab cake sandwhich and the shrimp po' boy.    The happy hour specials were very reasonable as well, with a large drink and appetizer selection.   They offer a small plate bar with a selection of small dishes such as oysters, shrimp cocktail, and much more.  They also have multiple outdoor bars and is a great location I have dinner and drinks with friends during the warmer months.  Worthwhile to check out with a group of friends!

QXCRFHlSQ1iy80jnKnh9xw.text: This place has been declining in food quality since opening.  Our first meal was great. The last few times have been vastly disappointing; not fresh, incorrectly cooked, gross old shrimp,  nasty chicken sandwiches, overpriced.   Was hoping this would be an awesome place to go for seafood but the focus seems to be on the outdoor club scene. Which has a bad reputation already...

QtVNF1GJfIVUJ6ekt-QTUQ.text: The food was good but the server could have cared less to deal with us. Maybe if kelsey didn't feel like treating me and my +1 like we didn't exist it would have been better. Next time I will ask who the server will be.

tmcVoQXH3df8xioKFFuLOA.text: So tonight we decided to give the Rumfish Grille a second chance. We probably shouldn't have. I'll get to why in just a minute.  I want to start out by saying that our server (named Jackie) was great. She was pleasant efficient and knowledgeable about the dishes. She couldn't be better.   Okay, that's the end of the compliments. We were asking a question about the menu when the manager showed up. She took a discussion of their vegetable choices and became confrontational. REALLY? I come from a management background. If a customer has an issue that they are trying to bring to a manager's attention, causing an argument with the customers is not good business practice. I told her that this was our second time there, we were not impressed with the establishment, but were here to give it a second chance. That would have been a cue to up their game, she missed the cue. I told her that I had reviewed them on yelp and would be again. Her response to that was appalling. She said that bad reviews were from disgruntled employees. Um... no. I 'm sitting in front of her telling her that I'm one of those reviewers.  I finally told her that picking a fight with a customer was exceptionally unprofessional. She started to stutter at this point, gave me a big fake smile, and stomped off. Wow.  Did I mention that this was all before we had finished ordering?  Our question was regarding the vegetables. They had a seasonal vegetable consisting of rubarb, parsnips and some other less than inviting veggie. They also had mushrooms, stewed tomatoes or cauliflower. My sweetheart wanted to substitute a salad, we had no problem with an upcharge. This was not available. My love ended up ordering a dinner salad to go with her dinner so that she could have some type of vegetable.   When the food came it was okay. At least the best of it was okay. We had it boxed up and will serve it to our dogs. As a matter of fact, our dogs had some of it this evening when we got home and they enjoyed it.  So, the bottom line is that the management is ignoring negative reviews and not understanding why the place isn't busy. I'm trying to come up with something positive to say... Well, if our dogs had thumbs they would have given a thumbs up.

x9o6KaJafZfzWka_OaPCyQ.text: Was excited to go back with good friends for Sunday brunch on 5/7/17, 1:30, had not been there in a couple of years. Six of us. Still a beautiful restaurant, but clearly only a bar/happy hour venue now. Food was so so, service was just awful, and the place was dead so no excuse. Took a 1/2 hour to get a glass of wine, when we asked why we were told they were busy with big takeout order?? Hey, we were THERE, so take care of us. When we slightly complained we were immediately told by our waitress that 'manager could discount our meal'.  (Very telling). Well when the check came that didn't happen, and neither did the manager. As we one by one made our visits to the bathroom we notice fruit salad on the floor, it was never cleaned up, as our waitress passed by it many times...an accident waiting to happen and like I said, the place was DEAD. Lazy? Unprofessional?  Who knows who cares. I'm done with this place. A great reunion with friends, but so disappointed. Can't believe it's still surviving, I had heard it went downhill but wanted to give it another try. Must be one heckuva place for happy hour, because to eat there? Sheesh. Management needs to step up. Expensive meal, bad and slow service. I've never posted on Yelp before, but had to. Get it together Rumfish.

xxSVv_LZ7yOwwfcPN9pByA.text: A friend and I and our girls come in today because it was on Groupon and it was a great deal, we hadn't been here in 2 years, hoping for a wonderful experience but not at all to say the least. First and foremost the service was terrible, the server was so unknowledgeable of the menu.. no matter what we asked him he was clueless, they better have another training session for their service staff! He forgot my drink, and my salad only to bring out the drink when I received my lunch, and never brought my salad...so so disappointed and the food has gone down hill since it first opened! Just terrible service and below average seafood. We will never return.

wusJlmEAryycYLYcGqe-TA.text: Wasn't really thrilled with the location in the restaurant where we were seated.  Weren't even offered seating outside, instead we were seated back near the kitchen where the servers all walk by with the food.  Took a while for our server to greet us and then to get our beverages.  Took my wife here for a date night and was disappointed since we had higher expectations and had hoped to enjoy a night out.  Probably on come back on bike nights if we come back.

Yxm4vec07BQdNg9fLJxFmA.text: I've given this place a few tries and every time I think it's just average at best. This last time we had fish tacos and shrimp tacos. Fish so over fried and over battered that I'm not even sure it could be called fish. The shrimp was so small and maybe 3 inside of each. Most places give you three ya is to an order, they do 2! I give it a 3star for the atmosphere

Rrvdi88YStLwSI_CZvabRA.text: Under portioned and over priced. Fish didn't have any flavor. They relied on the sauces to add flavor.   Service was good. Atmosphere was good.    I doubt I'll be going back.

pbOaUijyPtqGi9BKCbFqoQ.text: Came on a Wednesday evening and were seated at the bar overlooking the kitchen.  It was interesting to see the inner workings of the restaurant.  We were watching over the appetizer area.  Since I have not worked in the food industry, I wonder about the regulations about when to wear gloves and when it is permissible not to.  Yes, I understand that not wearing gloves happens more frequently than we know, but it was astonishing reminder seeing it repeatedly.  Ex. 1: plating salads, tacos, etc.  Ex. 2:  Worker put a small amount of chocolate sauce on a plate, realized it was a mistake, wiped it off with his finger, then plated the correct dessert.    The real reason for sub-par rating was the service.  As many mentioned, service is slow and inattentive.  Our waitress seemed like she was miserable at work and had little interest in her tables.  There was no greeting.  No listing of dinner or appetizer specials.  No "service".  Dialogue was nothing more than: "what do you want?" and "are you done?" before receiving the check.  Perhaps a really bad day?  I don't know.  Food was acceptable.  Clam fritter appetizer (much like a hush puppie) was the hit for dinner.  Meals didn't impress.  If you order the grits, expect five ... maybe six ... pieces of shrimp.  If there was a "positive", the outdoor patio looked inviting as we passed through the restaurant.  My concern would be whether or not we'd actually get drinks/service outdoors and if we could converse over the volume of the music.  The "potential" presented by the patio seating is the only reason to consider returning.

uis84ovWTXssRP4bA1GdPg.text: We were at rumfish on a cold friday night. We had a little room in the back of the restaurant that was very nice! I ordered lobster tail and macaroni and cheese. The lobster tail crumbled to pieces when I picked it up to pull out the meat. I tried to put my fork into the meat and it bounced off I could not even pierce the meat. I sent it back the waiter said a manager would be right in. the manager never came. I tried to eat the macaroni and cheese but the noodles were crunchy. The waiter did credit my meal and ignored me the rest of the meal. He did not offer me another drink did not apologize for my meal. Just acted as if I wasn't even there. We were a party of 9 and will not be returning.

p7V3UTXIkHoYcsNQX_timQ.text: My sister and I came for a late lunch around two, there was barely anyone eating at the time. The other customers who had a different server appears to have good service. However the server we had only had our table provided us with the dinner menu only with only entries when all the other customers had the lunch menu with sandwiches and other options.  After we waited a considerable about of time to order, the food was brought out in a staggered order disputed requesting to receive it all at once.  I ordered a pasta dish that was so sour I could not eat it. My sister had to get up and ask the manger for to go boxes because our server was no where to be found. The atmosphere at this restaurant was lovely. Maybe those who have a different waiter would have a better experience.

WlE6bKpPDtSVCzVjydoCuQ.text: We liked our meals and the atmosphere was fresh for the area. We are glad to see something new around town. We are excited to try the brunch with friends on a Sunday. My crab cakes were yummy and didn't even news sauce.

PJ3PkArxLdXg4WB8PBoQnw.text: 3rd time now, apparently I'm a massochist. It's legit the worst club/bar I've ever been to...

ltAPAQlrAY20HnwBBh5jBw.text: First off, I truly hope this local business does well. With that said, I'm disappointed in the rations and think the pricing is way to high all things considered. Even my 12 and 15 year old daughters were still hungry after they finished every bite. They had the fried chicken and sirloin respectivily. Here was my idea to my girlfriend to maybe manage the smaller portions, which we had fish. Offer a side salad and some sort of bread to help the consumer fill up on and that would possibly take away from the smaller portions.

M_RTezeZdAKG9KHKvj4iXg.text: What a pleasant surprise in Bridgeville!  The place survived their soft opening and now a large banner tells folks that they are now open for business. And I am glad!  There were three of us who dined for dinner. I had the peel and eat shrimp app that was perfect and another person had the octopus (good flavor though a bit rubbery). For the main course, I had Tuna with Cilantro Rice, Grilled Asparagus and the Ponzu sauce. It was magnificent.   Another member of our group had their regular Scallops entree (very good!) and the third person had their Scallop special (very good, as well). Although, one of the scallops in the Scallop special was undercooked, the waiter saw that and immediately took care of it.   I highly recommend this place for the food AND the atmosphere. There are three bars (one inside/outside) and two outside in the patio area that includes water features as well as fire pits; something you are not going to see anywhere else in Bridgeville, PA.

S1Pt3h52U7wHVeyRdjTeCg.text: Very bad experience tonight. Waited to be seated when the restaurant was nearly empty. Seated with no menus. Waited again for a waitress. Slow to refill drinks, slow to check back. Asked for 2 boxes and got 1. Received wrong check snd no pen to sign. Felt like we were intruding and not wanted there.

DD_kgauSNVLVXjD_iB_16Q.text: The Rumfish will be fun when the outside bar and eating area open up.  Just opened and have about 12 beers on draft, about 12 beers in bottles, about 12 beers in the can,about 12 red wines, about 10 white wines.  Nothing to shout home about but OK.    The menu has some seafood, some meat and some apps, and sandwiches.   We shared a Rumfish stew that was OK,   The couple beside us had the shrimp tacos and the Island BBQ and were pretty pleased.  Of  course they just opened and need some time to get their legs.  But this place has a lot of potential!   Hope that is reached!  Was looking to order more but the kitchen closed about 9:30.  Wish it was open a little later!  Our bar person was somewhat distracted but just learning the ropes, hope she improves!  Currently open at 4.  Not sure about future times, but there is a happy hour.

mu9WficXiIwBOujqiey0Rg.text: I can't speak for the recent average reviews about the food, but the "Beach" was great! It gets pretty packed on a Saturday night and the group I went with liked the atmosphere and the drink specials.

ZKaIDBgquhf6_MnnpSUhgQ.text: Nice enough place. I wasn't overly-impressed, but it was OK. I'd recommend the Mac & Cheese.

K5emsZNjmxpUjcm5eSUlVg.text: We had the half pound fish sandwiches, beer batter was awesome. For appetizers we had Rum Crab fish dip, highly recommend to anyone who comes in. The atmosphere was really nice and no wait on a Friday at 5pm. I will definitely be back!!

fepTa3nbpGNNn7Wpe3pyVw.text: We are here for a birthday party with 12 in the party and we had to sit at two separate tables??? On a Wednesday night! The kitchen can't handle everyone at one table
